direction.raw_text: The hotel is six stories high, a wall of glass and stucco. Beach chairs are arrayed around the pool's edge; sunbathers lie sprawled across them. A short boardwalk leads toward the Gulf of Mexico: the white sand, the blue water. Four young Americans are encamped near the pool's edge; they're all in their early twenties. AMY lies face down on a chaise, eyes shut, a cooler beside her. She's petite, with short blond hair, her skin pinkly sunburned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sits in the chair beside her, studying the Cliff Notes for The Canterbury Tales. He's leanly muscular, with dark curly hair. Other Cliff Notes lie scattered beneath his chair: Antigone, A Separate Peace, Hea rt of Darkness, 1984.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and STACY sit on the far side of the cooler; they're playing gin. Stacy, too, is petite, with short hair, though hers,. is dark. She's wearing a pale blue bikini, and has a beer bottle in her hand. She looks a little bored. Jeff is tall, scrawny. Like Eric, he has a pair of swim trunks on, and is deeply tanned. He's very focused, frowning down at his cards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We should play War. It's more fun. Jeff takes a card from his hand, lays it down on the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's not even a game.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure it is. I'll teach you. She starts-to fold her hand,'but Jeff shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know how to play. I mean it's just chance--there's no skill involved. Stacy frowns down at her hand, silenced. She picks a card from the deck, immediately discards it. Jeff snatches it up, lays down one of his own. Stacy stares at it in dismay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I keep losing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Cause you're not concentrating.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wouldn't have to concentrate if we played War.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Exactly. So where's the fun?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd win sometimes. It's not fun if we both can't win.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But it's not winning if it's just chance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course it is. If we flipped a coin, and I called heads, and it--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck..;this.. shit. Eric throws the Canterbury Tales to the ground. Then he rises, steps to the cooler, pulls out a beer, carries it back to his chair. Stacy watches as he takes a long swallow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe you should just be honest, sweetie. Eric doesn't even glance at her. He sips his beer again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) You could say: look, I don't know anything about these either, so now we're gonna read them together and sort of teach each other as we go. (turning to Jeff) Wouldn't you have loved that? To have a teacher who-- Amy speaks without opening her eyes, cutting Stacy off:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why would they hire you if you haven't read the books?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I said I had.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So maybe you should..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (appalled by the idea) The Canterbury Tales? You ever look at that shit?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've read it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck off. It's not even English. Jeff watches Stacy take another card; she examines it, sets it on the discard pile. Then, RECITING:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This world nys but a thurghfare ful of wo, and we been pilgrymes, passing to and fro. Deeth is an ende of every worldly soore. Eric and Stacy stare at Jeff in astonishment. Amy doesn't react. Jeff glances toward her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Sunscreen, Amy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm fine. I've got a base.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're burning. I can see it. She finally opens her eyes, lifts her head, peers at her shoulders. She presses at the pink skin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm just flushed. It's too hot. Stacy leans forward, picks a second card off the deck. Jeff is focused on Amy; he doesn't notice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're hot because you're burning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's only been-- Stacy interrupts, speaking in a slightly SINGSONG fashion:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So there was this king, who lived in a castle. Amy turns, gives her a pained look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please don't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But what he really wanted was a beach house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop it. Both of you. Right now. They ignore her, ping-ponging quickly back and forth:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So he decided to move.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But the Queen didn't want to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So he left by himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But he got lonely. Amy covers her ears with her hands, blocking out their voices, but then inmiediately reaches to feel for her earrings: one of them is missing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So he bought a dog.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But it had fleas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I lost my earring.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So he gave it a bath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But the dog caught. cold. Amy sits up, glancing about. Stacy and Eric keep going:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So he gave it some medicine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But it was the wrong kind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So the dog died. Amy rises, steps toward the pool. Jeff lays down his cards, joins her beside the water. They both peer into it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A young man is approaching down the boardwalk from the beach, carrying fins, a mask, a snorkel. He's in his early twenties: blond, crew-cut, very tall. His name is MATHIAS. As he nears the pool, he stops, staring.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eric and Stacy have risen to join Jeff and Amy; they're all peering into the water. Amy holds her remaining earring out to Eric and Stacy, showing them what it looks like.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - MATHIAS He stands there, hesitating. Then he starts forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - UNDERWATER - DAY We glide just above the pool's pale blue bottom. A silver earring comes into view. Mathias's hand reaches for it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The two couples have spread out around the pool's edge, searching for the earring. Mathias surfaces in front of Amy. He holds out his hand, with the earring-in it; she stares, startled, then crouches to take it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you so much. .Mathias nods. He starts to turn, as if to swim off, but Jeff stops him:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait. . .want a beer? He waves toward their chairs, the cooler beside them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mathias and the two couples sit together, with their beers. Amy's skin has turned deep red; Stacy is behind her, applying lotion to her shoulders. Eric is talking to Mathias:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We went sailing yesterday. Out toward Cozumel? And there were these seven foot fish, these huge--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nurse sharks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (he nods) Like thirty of them. A whole, you know, flock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: School.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The water was, I don't know, ten feet deep? And they were lying on the bottom, just waiting for somebody to come swimming by--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're not dangerous. Eric turns, stares at Jeff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You said they're sharks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But they're not dangerous. They eat lobsters. Sea urchins. That sort of thing. Eric considers this, frowning. Then he takes a sip of beer. He shrugs, turns back toward Mathias.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wouldn't be snorkeling on my own.' That's all I'm saying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . When Mathias speaks, it's with a SLIGHT GERMAN ACCENT:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wasn't on my own. I was with my brother. Jeff glances around the pool.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's here? Mathias shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He met a girl. They went away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a complicated story. They watch him, waiting for more, but nothing comes. Finally:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You should hang with us, then. If you're on your own. (he glances at the others) Right? Everyone nods, smiling. Eric reaches into the cooler, pulls out another beer, holds it toward Mathias.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a DJ, a dozen beer kegs. A few young men and women are dancing beside a bonfire, but most of the crowd is scattered in small groups across the sand, TALKING, drinking, the firelight flickering off their faces. Stacy, Amy, Eric, Jeff and Mathias are sitting together; they all have cups of beer. Stacy is between Eric's legs, leaning against his chest. Amy, Jeff and Mathias sit cross-legged. Everyone but Jeff and Mathias is a little drunk, and you can hear it in their voices. Amy drains her cup, stands up, very unsteadily. She holds out her hand to Jeff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dance. Eric smiles, as if the idea of Jeff dancing were absurd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jeff doesn't dance, Amy--he has no rhythm. Of all his many gifts, rhythm is not one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's not true. He played the trombone in high school. He won a prize. Eric seems startled by this, amused.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seriously? Amy nods. She drains her beer, tosses the cup aside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jeff's won prizes for everything. His Mom has a whole room built just for them. Trophies and ribbons and plaques. He's a very accomplished young man. (she holds out her hand-to
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ) You?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (he shakes his head) I don't dance on sand. Stacy makes a SNORTING sound.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Or grass. Or cement. Or carpet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I dance on teak.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Teak?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a type of wood. Very rare. Find me a teak floor and I'll be a dancing fool. Amy shifts toward Mathias, holds out her hand. He stares at it, then glances at Jeff. Before he can speak, Stacy pushes herself to her feet; she's almost as wobbly as Amy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll dance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . They lurch off across the sand toward the bonfire. The boys watch them go. A beat, then Jeff glances at his watch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm gonna head back. Eric gives him a look of disappointment,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're kidding. Jeff seems STARTLED by this:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How long is med school? Four years? Jeff nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) And then you got, whaddya call it, residency? Another nod. Eric turns toward Mathias.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) He's gonna be grinding away all that time. Sleepless. Fucking miserable. And know what? He's gonna look back on this night, us right here, and he's gonna say to himself, shit, I wish I'd--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gone to bed earlier. Eric stares at him; this wasn't the direction he was heading.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) If I'm gonna be so short on sleep, I should get as.much as I can now, don't you think? He stands up, brushes the sand from his shorts. Eric shrugs, lifts his cup toward him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All work and no play--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Makes a man healthy, wealthy, and wise. With that, Jeff nods good night to them, then starts off toward the hotel. Eric and Mathias turn back toward the bonfire. They sit in silence, watching the girls dance. After a moment, Amy staggers away from the other dancers, toward a group of young men, drinking together in the shadows. She reaches down, pulls one of them to his feet, starts to drag him back toward the bonfire. The young man is tall, with long blond hair. He LAUGHS, tries to free himself, but Amy is insistent; she keeps pulling at him, and finally he surrenders. They begin to dance. Stacy is dancing on her own, eyes shut, oblivious. Mathias glances toward Eric. Eric shrugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amy drifts sometimes, when she drinks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Drifts?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like a boat--she bumps into other boats. They continue to watch. Amy and her partner's dancing is becoming steadily more intimate, the gap between their bodies narrowing, then disappearing altogether. Finally, Eric pushes himself to his feet.'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Come on. Let's save everyone some grief. He starts. forward, followed by Mathias. They join Stacy and Amy, and Eric subtly interrupts Amy's pas de deux. The blond- haired young man disengages, drifts back toward his friends.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's quiet, the sun just breaking the horizon; the beach is nearly empty. A handful of hotel employees are tidying up after the bonfire: carrying off the empty kegs, raking clean the rubbish-strewn sand. Gulls hover overhead, CAWING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Jeff appears, running along the beach, his T-shirt soaked with sweat. He stops as he nears us, stands for a moment just above the line of surf, catching his breath, watching the sun rise. Then he turns, starts toward the hotel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A breakfast buffet: trays of pancakes, eggs, fresh fruit. There are a dozen tables beneath brightly colored umbrellas. Mathias is the only diner at this hour; he's dressed in jeans and a T-shirt. He studies a piece of paper as he eats.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) You're up early. Mathias lifts his head: Jeff is standing there in his sweaty shirt, smiling down at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have to catch a bus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To? Mathias slides the sheet of paper toward him. Jeff bends to look. There's a paragraph in German scrawled above a hand- drawn map, with four place names: Cancun, Valladolid, Tizimin, Coba. A large X has been drawn to the west of Coba.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The girl my brother met was on her way to this place, to work. (he waves at the map) It's a dig--an archaeological dig. And he went with her. He left the map, saying I could come, too, if I got bored on my own. A beat; he watches Jeff examine the map. Then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Our flight leaves the day after tomorrow. I can wait and hope he returns in time.. Or I can go get him. It's a question of trusting him to do the right thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you don't?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Henrich doesn't think things through. He runs at them. He's... (he searches, shakes his
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ) There's a word in English, but I can't remember it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: impetuous?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (he nods) So I have to be--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Responsible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All our lives, the same story. Jeff.slides the map back toward him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's what? One of those pyramids?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (he shakes his head) An old mining camp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: De oro? 0 plata? Mathias just stares at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) You don't speak Spanish? Mathias shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) So how will you find this place?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (he smiles, shrugs) Follow the m ap. Jeff frowns down at the map for a long beat. It seems as if he's going to question the feasibility of this, but. then he disengages instead, wiping at the sweat on his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, good luck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Mathias nods his thanks, and Jeff turns, starts away from the table. WE MOVE with him, across the terrace, into the:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's completely empty at this hour, and eerily silent. Chairs are stacked on the tables. As Jeff enters, a waiter moves past ham, carrying a pitcher of orange juice. Jeff stops, turns to watch through the window beside the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The waiter refills Mathias's glass. Mathias smiles, nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jeff hesitates, wavering. Then he pushes open the door again, steps outside. We watch--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: --as he approaches Mathias. There's the sound of someone
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . This carries over into:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A rack with towels on it, a sink, a tub. Amy is crouched over the toilet, in underwear and a T-shirt, VOMITING. Her skin is bright red. Jeff is standing in the tub, freshly showered, drying himself, watching. her. His running clothes hang from a hook beside the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You okay? Amy doesn't answer. She COUGHS, spits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) You don't have to come, you know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm fine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't look fine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you. That's very helpful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . She pushes herself to her feet, flushes the toilet, steps to the sink, squeezes some toothpaste onto a toothbrush.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll be back by nightfall. You can just-- Amy is raising the brush to her mouth, but she stops, gives Jeff a look in the mirror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't want me to come?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's not what I'm saying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what're you saying?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're hungover, under slept,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not sunburned. Jeff stares at her, the deep red of her face. Then he shrugs, steps out of the tub, the towel around his waist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .All right. My mistake. Amy bends over the sink, starts to brush her teeth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A king-sized bed, a bureau, two night tables, a mini-fridge. Jeff emerges from-the bathroom, steps toward the bureau, starts to dress: boxers, jeans, T-shirt. A beat, then Amy shuffles out of the bathroom. She sits on the edge of the bed, starts to pull on a pair of shorts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pants. Amy stops, the shorts around her ankles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll get too sweaty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Jeff pulls a pair of khakis from the bureau, tosses them onto the bed beside her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's gonna be mosquitoes. He picks up a knapsack, steps to the mini-fridge, opens its door. Amy stares down at the khakis for a beat, then drops back onto the bed. She lies there, looking up at the ceiling, her shorts still caught around her ankles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We don't even know this guy. Jeff slides two bottles of iced tea into the knapsack. There's a plastic shopping bag beside the fridge, and he starts to dig through it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just don't see why we have to go with him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you and I were traveling together, somewhere you didn't speak the language, and I'd vanished somehow, wouldn't you want someone to help find me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why would you vanish? Jeff turns, looks at her: this isn't the point.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aren't you getting bored? Honestly. The beach, the pool, the beach, the pool. This'll be fun. An adventure. Jeff pulls two protein bars from the bag, a box of raisins, a plastic bag full of grapes; he drops them into the knapsack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) You said you wanted to go;hiking, didn't you? See the ruins. Amy is silent, unmoving, clearly not swayed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Stay here, then. Seriously. There's no--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why do you keep saying that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's like you'd rather I didn't--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: at the door, and she falls silent. Jeff rises, zipping shut the knapsack. He steps to the door, opens it. Stacy and Eric are in the hall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ready? The both answer at the same time:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amy's having second thoughts. Jeff doesn't want me to go. Stacy and Eric are silent; neither wants to get involved in this. A beat, then Jeff SIGHS, glances at his watch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now or never, Any. .We're gonna miss the bus. Amy gives a loud GROAN, sits up, reaches for her khakis.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Only half the seats are occupied: tourists with their packs and cameras-and hats. Little TVs hang from the ceiling. We MOVE slowly down the aisle, passing Jeff and Amy first. Amy is sound asleep, a camera hanging from her neck, a Panama hat in her lap. Jeff is beside her, bent low over a tour book, comparing its much more detailed map with the one Mathias's brother left behind. Next come Eric and Stacy, hunched together in their seats, watching a Mexican soap opera on the little TV above them. Stacy mimics the actors' exaggerated gestures, GIGGLING. Eric has the Cliff Notes for Hamlet in his lap, unopened. Finally, there's Mathias. The seat beside him is empty. He's staring out the window, his expression perfectly blank.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The town is very small: a dirt road lined with one- and two- story buildings, some with thatched roofs. There's a gravel turnaround, with a bus idling in it. Its door CREAKS open. A dozen tourists emerge from the bus, blinking in the sunlight. Jeff, Amy, Stacy, Eric, and Mathias are among them. The boys have the knapsacks; the girls are wearing matching hats. Amy rubs at her face, stretching, waking up.- There's a souvenir stand at the town's entrance, with brightly colored blankets hanging from its walls. The tourists start toward it, leaving Jeff and the others beside. the idling bus. They peer about, getting their bearings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now what? Mathias has his brother's note. He holds it out, pointing, and they gather around him to look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We take a cab. To here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the map: there's a line drawn from Cancun to Coba, where another, shorter line moves westward. Mathias's finger moves along this shorter line, toward the X on the map.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How far?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eighteen kilometers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How many miles is that? They all glance at Jeff. He shrugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eleven. A little more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then there'll be a path. Which we hike--four kilometers. The others look to Jeff again. He slings his pack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two and a half miles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The tourists are vanishing into the town. The bus's door
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: shut.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't see any cabs. The bus eases into motion, CRUNCHING across the gravel, pulling out onto the road. Behind it, a yellow pickup truck is revealed. "TAXI" is hand-painted in black on its side. They start toward the truck. Its DRIVER is Mayan: short and heavy-set, with thick glasses. His eyes are shut; he's dozing behind the wheel. The truck's engine.is running, the windows shut tight against the heat. Jeff TAPS the window, and there's a burst of movement from the truck's rear, as a dog springs up, BARKING and GROWLING. They all leap back, the girls SHRIEKING. The dog is a mutt--small, but muscular. He's attached to a cinder block by a short chain, which he throws himself against, slobbering, snapping at the air. They all stare at the dog; the girls LAUGH nervously, clutching each other. The driver has roused himself; he leans forward, rolls down his window, stares out at them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hola. The man gives him a somber nod; the dog keeps BARKING. Jeff takes the map from Mathias, then steps warily forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Habla ingles usted? The man half-nods, half-shrugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) How much to drive us to here? He offers the map to the driver, who reaches to take it. The man frowns at it. Then, in HEAVILY ACCENTED ENGLISH:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why you go this place? Jeff struggles for a simple way to explain their mission. in the back of the truck, the dog continues its frantic BARRING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There are these ruins. This old mining camp? (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) (he points toward Mathias) And his brother---
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fifteen dollar, I take you ruins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To here? Jeff points at the map. The driver shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This place no good. He holds the map back out toward Jeff. Jeff takes it, gives the man a puzzled look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No good?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No good you go. Fifteen dollar I take you good place. You like, I promise. Jeff glances toward the others, as if for help. They all just stand there, watching. The dog won't stop BARRING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) I take you pyramid. Huy grande. Everyone happy. He smiles at Jeff; his teeth are large and thick-looking,. and black along the gums. Jeff pulls out his wallet. He removes a ten and a five, then points at the map.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How about we pay you fifteen dollars to go here? He holds the money out. The man doesn't even look at it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I tell you no good. Still you go? His smile has disappeared; he seems angry suddenly, as if Jeff has somehow insulted him. Jeff hesitates, glancing toward the others again. Then, in a CONCILIATORY TONE:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're looking for his brother. (he points toward Mathias) Su hermano?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The driver wrenches the door open, making Jeff and the others flinch. He climbs out, still with that angry expression on his face, then leans into the back of the truck, grabs the dog's chain, unhooks it from the cinder block. He lifts the dog from the truck by the chain. Even dangling by its neck, the mutt continues to SNARL and snap at Jeff and the others. They back away, and the man tosses the dog into the truck's cab, pushing the door shut. The dog throws its body against the window, slobbering and BARKING. The man turns toward Jeff, wiping his hands on his pants. Jeff tries again:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) I'm sure your ruins are better than these. It's just that we-- The driver cuts him off, holding out his hand, with that same air of enraged disgust.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: El dinero. Jeff gives him the money. Then the driver SLAPS the side of the truck, gestures for them to climb into the back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Below us, the yellow truck travels along a single-lane road. Jeff and the others are in its rear. There are fields on either side of the road, bordered by thick jungle. The truck reaches a fork in the road, bears left, angling toward the wall of jungle, into which it vanishes, the overhanging foliage blocking it from sight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The road is dirt, heavily rutted. There's a small clearing beside it, with a path opening off it. The trees grow over the path, forming a shady tunnel. WE HEAR birds calling, a steady throb of insect life, but otherwise all is silent. A beat, then there's the sound of the TRUCK approaching, along with the dog's BARKING and GROWLING. The pickup appears, moving slowly, bouncing and swaying across the ruts. The truck pulls into the little clearing, stops. Jeff and the others clamber out over its tailgate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The dog is still lunging at them from behind the truck's rear window. Jeff gives the driver a wave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gracias, senor! The driver doesn't even look at him; he just pulls out onto the road, heading back in the direction from which they came. There are mosquitoes; Stacy starts to slap at herself. Jeff unslings his pack, pulls out a can of insect repellent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Here. He begins to spray her, then Eric. Amy is peering off after the truck. They can still hear the dog's BARKING, but very faintly now. Jeff finishes with Eric, starts in on Mathias.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do we get back? She points back down the road, toward the vanished truck. Jeff pauses in his spraying, considers for a moment. Then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The guidebook said you can always flag down a passing bus. So I-- AMY There aren't going to be any buses on that road. Jeff nods; this seems obvious. He resumes spraying Mathias. Eric and Stacy stand there, watching.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) A bus couldn't even fit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It also said you can hitch--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See any cars pass, Jeff? Jeff doesn't answer. He steps toward her, starts to spray her, too. She holds out her arms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) The whole time we were driving, you see even one?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eric has his phone. Can't we just call someone?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's not gonna get a signal. Not way out here. They all turn to watch as Eric reaches into. his pack, pulls out his cell phone, flips it open. He stares at it for a beat, then shakes his head, snaps it shut. Jeff finishes spraying Amy, starts in on himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They must-have a way to get supplies in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The archaeologists. They must have a truck. Or access to a truck. When we find Mathias's brother, we can just ask them to take us all back to Coba. (turning to Mathias) Right? Mathias seems startled by the question.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess ...I mean, I-- He shrugs; he has no idea. Amy is still focused on Jeff:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're stranded, aren't we? That's, like, a twenty mile walk we're gonna have to do. Through the jungle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eleven.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? Jeff finishes with the insect repellent, crouches to slide the can back into his pack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's eleven miles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's no way that was eleven miles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Jeff rises, slings his pack. He gives Amy a tired look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's just find this place, okay? Then we can figure out how to get back. Amy is silent. Jeff turns to the others.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Ready? Mathias and Eric nod, and the boys start down the path. Amy stands there, watching them go. Stacy steps toward her.'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just go with it, honey. You'll see--it'll all work out. She hooks arms with her, pulls her into motion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They hike in single file: first Jeff, then Eric, Mathias, Stacy, and Amy. The path is six feet wide, hard-packed dirt. All around and above is the jungle: big-leafed plants, vines and creepers, immense trees. The path moves in snakelike curves; we can't see-very far in either direction. They're all sweating, their shirts clinging to their bodies. The bugs continue to harass them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So-there was this girl who bought a piano. Amy gives a loud MOAN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But she didn't know how to play.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So she signed up for lessons.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But she couldn't afford them. Stacy reaches, taps Mathias's shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can play, too. If you want.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Mathias glances back at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) It's easy. Someone says So, then you say But. It's like catch, only without a ball. (to Eric) So she got a job in a factory.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But was fired for being late. Amy takes off her hat, wipes the sweat from her face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's annoying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So she became a prostitute.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's tedious and boring. And once they start, it's impossible to get them to stop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But she fell in love with her first client. Amy puts her hat back on. She looks hot, sweaty, tired.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How much farther? Mathias peers down at his brother's note. Stacy and Eric continue with their game.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We cross a stream. Then So she asked him to marry there'll be a path, branching her. off to our left. If we see a village, we've gone too far.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) ERIC A village? But he was already married.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mayan village. So she begged him to get a divorce.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) ERIC Will they have air But he was in love with his conditioning? wife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Mathias shrugs, returns the note to his pocket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It just says there's a So she decided to kill her. village.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) I think we should go see it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Me, too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think we should--- Jeff stops suddenly, pointing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The stream. Thirty feet in front of them, the trail dips toward a small stream, studded with boulders. It resumes on the far bank, rising gradually uphill in a long straightaway. The stream is slow moving, the water dark brown. Eric SNIFFS the air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fucking smells.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They must use it as a latrine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The village. The Mayans. They start toward it, gingerly, the girls covering their noses. Jeff crosses the stream, hopping from boulder to boulder, and the others follow. Stacy almost falls in; she only catches her balance at the final instant, YELPING. Jeff is already starting up the trail, searching for the turnoff. There's no sign of it; the dense foliage extends unbroken as far as the eye can see. He turns to Mathias.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) How far past the stream?.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right after, it says.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . They stand there in a loose group, staring at the trees. Eric pulls a bottle of water from his pack, takes a swallow, then passes it to Stacy. Amy lifts her arm, points.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look. Up the trail, sixty feet away, stand two small Mayan boys; they seem to have materialized out of the air. They're ten years old, shirtless, scrawny, dark-haired. one of them is holding a bicycle by its handlebars; it doesn't have a seat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Maybe they can guide us. Stacy smiles toward the boys; she waves, CALLS OUT:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The boys just stand there, staring at them, silent, their expressions wary, even frightened. One of them leans to whisper something to the other, who nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why don't we-- He stops, noticing Mathias. The German is staring toward the edge of the trail, where a large bush sits. one of its fronds is very slowly dropping toward them, pulling itself free of the soil. Mathias steps forward, tugs at a second frond, which slips easily from the dirt. He tosses it aside, reaches for another frond: this, too, slips free. Someone has pushed them into the earth, arranging them to look like a bush. Mathias pulls a fourth frond free, then a fifth, and an opening is revealed in the brush, a narrow path winding its way off through the trees. They stand there a beat, staring at it. Then there's a SQUEAKING SOUND, and they all turn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: one of the boys is hurriedly pedaling off, bent low over the bicycle's handlebars. His companion remains behind, staring toward us with a look of obvious anxiety.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amy turns to Jeff; so do the others.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why was it covered? Jeff lifts his hands: how should he know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe it's not the right path.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: one speaks. They keep staring from the boy to the newly revealed path, trying to make sense of it. WE can still HEAR the squeaking of the bicycle, growing steadily fainter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's on the map.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a hand-drawn map, Jeff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And it was hidden. Why would it be hidden? Jeff steps forward, shields his eyes, tries to peer into the dimness of the narrow path. Then he glances back toward the little boy, who continues to stand there, watching them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe the archaeologists don't want people to find the mine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because? Jeff has to think. Finally:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe they've dug up something valuable. Emeralds or something. Or silver. Whatever they were mining in the first place. And they don't want anyone to come rob them. So they've asked the Mayans to help keep people away. He falls into silence, staring at the boy. No one appears very convinced by his theory, not even Jeff. He shrugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) How much farther is it? Mathias takes the map from his pocket again, glances at it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not far.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Be silly to stop now, don't you think? No one answers; no one moves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This just feels weird, Jeff. Jeff SIGHS, fighting to suppress his impatience with her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So we what? Turn around? Walk all the way back to Coba? Silence. They all turn to stare back down the trail, then toward the Mayan boy, who's still watching them. Stacy SLAPS a mosquito, leaving a bloody smear on her bare arm. Jeff lifts his hand, gestures at the path.leading into the trees.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Come on. We're almost there. The others glance at one another, waiting for someone to argue; no one does. Finally, Mathias steps forward, slipping through the narrow opening. Eric follows him, and then, with just the slightest hesitation, so do Amy and Stacy. Jeff throws one last glance toward the boy--who's still standing there, sixty feet away, watching with his anxious expression--and then he, too, vanishes into the trees.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They make their way along the winding path, one after another, all of them sweating, slapping at the mosquitoes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe the ruins are sacred. You know? And they don't want people digging them up. He glances about, off into the trees, a little spooked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) We could be walking through some sort of ancient graveyard right now. And they've--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a mine. An old mining camp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's nothing sacred about it. Eric considers this as they walk. The others are also quiet: too hot to speak. The sunlight falls through the trees in thin, shifting columns, hazed with mosquitoes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe it leads to a marijuana field, then. Maybe the village is growing pot, and that boy rode off to get them, and they're gonna come with guns and--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eric.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut up, okay? Eric falls silent. They follow the path as it curves first right, then left, moving gradually uphill all the while, and suddenly there's sunlight in front of them, bright and intense: a clearing. They hesitate at its edge, staring.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The clearing is twenty yards wide, and extends in either direction as far as the eye can see, finally curving out of sight. Its soil is a deep black, flecked with white, like frost rime. It's completely free of vegetation. The path resumes on the far side of the clearing, winding its way up asmall hill. The hill is rocky, oddly treeless, and covered with a vinelike growth--a vivid green, with hand- shaped leaves and tiny red flowers. Jeff and the others step warily out onto the cleared ground, peering about, squinting in the sudden sunlight. They stare up at the flower-covered-hill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . There are hints of ruins among the thick foliage: giant boulders with faint carvings etched onto their surfaces, the crumbling remains of a fallen pillar, everything half-buried beneath the vine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's beautiful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So beautiful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And the mosquitoes are gone. You realize that? They've stopped biting. She smiles at the others, delighted by this development. Amy removes the cap from her camera, starts to take pictures.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a click as she takes each photo, and the image freezes for an instant. There's the hillside, covered in its vine, its red flowers:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . There's Eric pulling the water bottle from his pack:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . There's Stacy smiling at us, waving: CLICK. There's Mathias shading his eyes, peering up the hill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.} Smile, Mathias.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that a tent? He points.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amy lowers her camera, turns to look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An orange square of fabric is just visible, at the very top of the hill, billowing, sail-like, in the breeze. From this distance, with the rise of the hill partly blocking the view, its hard to tell what it is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They all stand there, peering up the hill. Faintly, but growing steadily louder, a THUDDING noise comes from the jungle. The five of them turn, heads cocked, listening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A horse. It's true: HOOFBEATS are approaching at a gallop. Instinctively, Jeff and the others back a handful of steps toward the hill. A long. beat, then a horseman bursts into the clearing, rearing to a halt. Amy lifts her camera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A bald Mayan man is on the horse; he's broad-shouldered, short, in his early forties, dressed in a white shirt and pants. The horse rears a second time, and the image FREEZES for an instant, with a CLICK, as Amy snaps another picture.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The bald man SHOUTS at them in UNSUBTITLED MAYAN. His horse is lathered, SNORTING, rolling its eyes. It rears yet again, and the man half-falls, half-jumps to-the ground. Jeff and the others back a few more steps into the clearing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The bald man is still holding the reins; the horse is backing away from him, jerking its head, trying to break free, pulling him, step-by-step, back toward the trail. CLICK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The man can't gain control of the horse. Finally, he drops the reins, and the horse gallops into the jungle, CRASHING through the trees, its hoofbeats gradually diminishing. The man turns toward them, starts YELLING in MAYAN again, pointing back down the trail. Sweat shines on his forehead. There's a gun on his belt, a black pistol in a brown holster. Stacy is clutching Eric's arm, looking frightened.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's he saying?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe he wants money? A toll or something? The Mayan continues SHOUTING, waving his arm. Jeff reaches into his pocket, pulls out his wallet, removes a twenty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dinero? The man ignores the proffered bill, makes a shooing motion, waving them from the clearing. Mathias turns toward the hill, cups his hands around his mouth, SHOUTS:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's no response, just the orange fabric gently billowing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why don't you hike up, see if you can find him? We'll try to sort this out. Mathias nods, starts across the clearing. The bald man
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: at him in Mayan, and then, when Mathias doesn't stop, pulls his pistol from its holster, FIRES into the sky. Everyone flinches, half-ducking. Stacy SCREAMS. Mathias goes still. The man waves at him, YELLING in Mayan, and Mathias comes back, his hands raised, to join the others.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: are approaching from the jungle again. They come closer and closer, and suddenly two more horsemen burst into the clearing. They're younger than the bald mans in their twenties, dark-haired, muscular. One has a mustache. Their mounts are white-eyed, SNORTING, rearing, just like the bald man's. The two men jump to the ground, dropping their reins, and the horses immediately turn and gallop back into the jungle. Amy lifts her camera again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The young men have bows slung across their chest, and quivers of thin, fragile-looking arrows. They question the bald man in MAYAN, very rapidly. He's still aiming his pistol at Mathias. A CLICK, and the image freezes for an instant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As they continue to interrogate the bald man in MAYAN, the young men unsling their bows, each of them nocking an arrow. Reflexively, Jeff and the others retreat another handful of steps into the clearing. Mathias still has his hands raised.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the fuck?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Quiet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait. Wait and see. Amy is a bit farther into the clearing than Jeff and the others. She keeps swinging her camera from them to the Mayans, trying to capture the whole scene in one shot. She's too close, though,-and she retreats another handful of steps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Still backing up toward the hill; all of them but Stacy and Eric are in the frame now. The bald Mayan is still answering the young men's questions. He turns toward us suddenly, points his pistol directly at us,.starts to SHOUT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jeff and the others turn, too, staring at Amy in surprise. She's nearly at the far edge of the clearing, peering through her camera; she retreats another step. The young Mayans raise their bows, drawing them; the bald man keeps YELLING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She takes another step; she's right up against the vines.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stacy is in the frame now. We retreat one more step, and so is Eric, and the Mayans with their raised weapons, the bald man still SHOUTING: everything FREEZES on the CLICK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amy lowers her camera. The Mayan with the mustache turns to the other two, points toward her feet, SPEARING URGENTLY. The bald Mayan slowly lowers his pistol, looking dismayed. Amy glances down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's stepped out of the clearing, into the flowering vine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Both of the younger Mayans are speaking now, their voices
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The bald Mayan is shaking his head, protesting, but they talk right over him. Amy steps clear of the vine, starts back toward Jeff, and the younger Mayans draw their bows taut again, aiming at her chest. She freezes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jeff lifts his hand, without looking, his eyes on the Mayans.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't move. The bald man continues to frown and shake his head. He points to Amy, then the others; he waves toward the jungle. But the young men are implacable--they keep arguing, gesturing--and finally the bald man gives in, falls SILENT. A beat, then the bald man raises his pistol, aims it at Jeff's chest. He makes a shooing motion with his other hand, but now it's toward Amy, and the hill beyond her. He begins to SHOUT; the other men do, too. Then the bald man
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a bullet into the dirt at Jeff's feet. Everyone jumps, starts to retreat. The men with the bows are swinging them back and forth, herding them toward the hill. When Jeff and the others reach Amy, the bald man points toward the trail, waves them up it. He watches--his expression looking stricken, close to tears--as the five of them obediently begin to climb the vine-covered hill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Midway up the hill, they pause to catch their breath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Check your phone, Eric. Eric pulls out his phone, flips it open, stares at it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing.. He snaps it shut. They stand there: sweating, scared looking. Mathias cups his hands to his mouth again, SHOUTS:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Henrich...I They all peer up the hill, waiting for a response.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -- UP THE HILL It is a tent: bright orange, looking a bit worse for wear. The vine is growing up its aluminum poles as if on a trellis. .The tent faces away from us; its doorway is hidden. There's no sign or sound of any people.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eric turns, glances back down the hill, shielding his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's another one. He points toward the clearing below them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: THE CLEARING A fourth man has arrived, on a bicycle. He's dressed in white, like the others, with a straw hat on his head. A beat, then two more Mayans appear, also on bicycles. They all have bows slung over their shoulders. The bald man addresses these newcomers. He waves in either direction, and the other men start off along the clearing, two one way, three the other, leaving him alone at the base of the hill. A beat, then a little boy appears from the jungle--the one who'd watched them discover the camouflaged path. He and the bald man stand there, peering up at us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eric turns to the others, EXCITED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's run back down. Quick. While there's just him and the kid. We can rush them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's got a gun, Eric. This silences Eric--silences all of them. Mathias turns,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: toward the tent again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Henrich...1 There's no answer. They wait another beat, then Jeff waves them back into motion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The hill is flat on top, forming a wide plateau. Beyond the orange tent is a small clearing of rocky ground. A blue tent sits on the far side of the clearing, looking just as weathered as the orange one, the vine growing up its poles. The five of them pause, peering about. Jeff CALLS OUT:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The vine covers everything but the trail and the clearing. We glimpse more rubble beneath its greenery: time- worn stelae, a low stone wall. In some places the vine folds back upon itself, forming waist- high mounds, tangled knoll-like profusions of green. And everywhere, hanging off it, are those bright red flowers. Mathias moves toward the orange tent, and Jeff follows him. They UNZIP its flap, stoop to peer inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The vine has taken root in here, too, growing on some things, leaving others untouched. There are three sleeping bags unrolled on the floor. An oil lamp. Two backpacks. A roll of duct tape. A bottle of tequila. A metal canteen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jeff and Mathias ZIP the flap back shut. Eric, Stacy and Amy are fifteen feet away, watching.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's inside?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing. Some camping supplies. Mathias starts across the clearing toward the blue tent, followed by Jeff and the others. He UNZIPS its flap, sticks his head inside. Jeff leans to look, too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The same thing: sleeping bags, backpacks, camping supplies. The vine is growing on some things, but not on.others.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ten yards beyond the tent, there's a hole cut into the dirt. Stacy, Amy, and Eric have gathered at its edge; Jeff and Mathias join them. The hole is rectangular--ten feet by six feet--and very deep; we can't see its bottom. A windlass has been constructed beside the hole, a horizontal barrel with a hand crank welded to its base. Rope is coiled around the barrel. From there, it passes over a small wheel, which hangs from a sawhorse straddling the hole's mouth. Then it drops straight into the earth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The mine? Jeff nods. A draft is rising from the hole, and it lifts off Amy's hat. She tries to catch it, but fumbles: the hat falls away from her. They all watch it vanish into the dark. Eric pulls out his phone, flips it open, almost absentmindedly: a nervous gesture. There's still no signal. He closes it, turns to survey the clearing, the empty tents.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now what? Jeff shrugs, waves past the shaft. The clearing ends just a few yards from them;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . then the vines resume, and in the midst of the vines is the path. It winds its way to the edge of the hilltop, vanishes over it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keep going, I guess. Saying this, he slings his pack onto his shoulder. Then he starts forward, the others falling in behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They pick their way down the trail. It's much steeper on this side; there are short stretches where they have to drop onto their rear ends and slide, one after another. It's after one of these that Jeff suddenly stops, staring.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It looks as if the jungle has been chopped down all the way around the base of the hill, isolating it in a ring of barren soil. One of the Mayans has made his way along this cleared ground to the base of the trail. He's staring up at them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Fuck. The man slides his bow off his shoulder, nocks an arrow. He shakes his head at them, CALLS OUT in MAYAN, waves them away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The five of them stand there, staring down at the man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do we do? Jeff shrugs, starts forward again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll see. The others hesitate, and then, one after another, resume their downward march.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As they approach the clearing, the Mayan man YELLS what sounds like someone's name.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A beat, then another bowman comes jogging into view. Jeff and the others stop at the bottom of the trail. They stand there, staring. The vine has invaded the clearing here. Ten feet in front of the path is one of those odd, knoll-like growths, knee-high, thick with flowers. The two Mayans are another twenty feet beyond it, in the center of the clearing, bows drawn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So. Her skin is slick with sweat, and she's winded from the hike down. A third Mayan comes jogging toward them. He stops beside the other two, draws his bow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We should rush them. All at once.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut Up, Eric.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Or go make shields. If we had some shields, we could-- He falls silent as another Mayan comes running toward them. along the clearing. This one is bearded, heavier than the others. And he's carrying a rifle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh my god. Jeff is staring at the little isolated island of vines, ten feet in front of them--peering intently at it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's go back up. Jeff takes a step forward into the clearing--slowly, warily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) I wanna go back. Jeff takes another step, edging toward the mound, his eyes on the Mayans, their raised weapons. They just watch him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He ignores her, takes a third step, then a forth, which brings him to the mound of vines. He crouches, reaches into the tendrils, parting them. He grasps a stalk, tugs, pulls it free. WE SEE a tennis shoe, a sock, a man's shin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Jeff turns, stares at Mathias, who steps forward, crouches beside him, starts to pull at the vines, gently at first, then more aggressively, tearing them, the plant's sap shining on his skin, a low MOAN rising from his chest. Another shoe is revealed, another leg, a pair of jeans, a belt buckle, a black T-shirt. And then, finally: a young man's face, the flesh oddly eaten away, so that his cheekbone is visible, the white socket of his left eye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Oh, no. Oh, Jesus. Jeff holds up his hand, silencing her. The Mayans stand there, in the center of the clearing, watching. Mathias has begun to rock slightly, that MOANING coming and going. Jeff touches his shoulder, WHISPERS:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Easy. All right? Easy and slow. We'll stand up and we'll walk away. We'll walk back up the hill. The young man's T-shirt is stiff with dried blood. There are. three slender arrows impaled in his chest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's my brother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They killed him. Jeff nods, his hand still on Mathias's.shoulder; he squeezes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shh. Not here. Up the hill, okay? Mathias is struggling to control his breathing; the MOANS keep coming. Finally, he manages a nod, and they both stand up. Stacy and Amy are holding hands, looking stricken. Stacy has started to CRY. Eric has his arm around her. The Mayans keep their weapons raised. They watch in silence as Jeff and the others turn to start back up the hill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jeff and Mathias are at the top of the trail, staring down toward the clearing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: More Mayans are appearing from the jungle. They're all armed. The bald man sends them out along the clearing, some in one direction, some 'the other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jeff and Mathias stand there, grim-faced, watching. Mathias lifts his hands, stares at them. They've turned a deep, raw- meat red, as if scarred. He flexes his fingers, wincing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amy, Stacy, and Eric sit in the clearing, beside the shaft, passing a bottle of water among themselves. Eric is struggling to calm the girls:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can sneak past once the sun...-' sets, I bet. You know? Just reep by them in the dark? Stacy and Amy hardly seem to hear him; they look dazed, distraught. Eric passes the bottle to Stacy. A beat, then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) And then there's the girl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The girl?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The one his brother met. What happened to her? Amy and Stacy are silent. Stacy lifts the water bottle to her lips, but immediately lowers it, and starts to CRY again. Amy takes her hand. Eric watches them, silent. Then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) And the archaeologists. You think-- Stacy's crying deepens toward a SOB. Amy gives Eric a look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop it, Eric.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just stop, okay? Stop talking. Stacy struggles to collect herself, breathing deep. She wipes at her face. Amy keeps stroking her hand. Jeff and Mathias are approaching across the hilltop. Mathias holding his burned-looking hands out in front of him. He 9 a nd Jeff crouch beside the others.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened? Jeff takes the bottle from Stacy. He pours a tiny bit of water on Mathias's hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's something in the plants. The sap--it burned his skin. Mathias rubs at his hands with his shirt, grimacing. Amy reaches to take the water back from Jeff. She starts to lift the bottle to her mouth, but..Teff leans forward, grabs it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Don't. We need to save it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I'm thirsty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We all are.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So let's drink. Jeff shakes his head, capping the bottle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We don't have that much. We need to ration it. (he glances up at the sky) We'll have to figure out a way to catch the rain. Everyone but Amy peers up at the sky: it's a perfect, cloudless blue. Amy remains focused on Jeff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm hungover. I'm sunburned. I lost my hat. I need some water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why do you get to decide? Jeff stares at her, considering this. Then he shrugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fine. Let's vote. (he glances at the others) But first you should understand that each of us is gonna need half a gallon of water a day, at a minimum, to survive here. That's two and a half gallons total, every day. And right now, until it rains, we don't have it. Okay? Not even one day's worth. (a beat) Now who wants to give Amy more water? A long moment of silence. No one can meet Amy's eyes. Finally, VERY QUIETLY:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe we should just wait, honey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Till? Everyone looks toward Jeff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Another hour or so. Then we'll all have a sip. Okay? Amy can see that she has no choice. She gives a grudging nod, and Jeff slides the bottle into his knapsack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) We have to get organized. Now. While we're still fresh. We'll have to stay out of the sun, spend as much time as possible in the tents. We'll have to--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't we sneak away when it gets dark? Eric said we--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Jeff shakes his head, cutting her off. He waves across the hilltop, toward where he and Mathias had been standing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They keep coming. More and more of them. They're all armed, and the bald one sends them out along the clearing. They're surrounding us. Amy, Stacy and Eric struggle to absorb this. Finally:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why don't they just kill us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's got something to do with the hill, I think. Once you step on it, you're not allowed off. Something like that. They won't step on it themselves, but now that we're here, they won't let us leave. So we have to figure out a way to survive till someone comes and finds-us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who? Jeff lifts one hand, palm-up, half a shrug.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: People'll start to worry when we don't return home. Right? And
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're not supposed to leave till Friday. Jeff nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) And they'll have to come searching. Again, he nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) So you're talking--what, a week? .JEFF Something like that. Amy looks appalled; her voice JUMPS:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can't live here for a week, Jeff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If we try to leave, they'll shoot us. That's the one thing we know for certain. An electronic CHIRPING comes from the shaft: it sounds like a cell phone ringing. Mathias turns his head, listening. No one else notices it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But what will we eat? How will we-- The RINGING comes again, silencing her. She glances toward the shaft, not quite believing what she's hearing. It comes a THIRD TIME, and they all stand up, step to the hole, peer into its darkness. The RINGING comes yet again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A cell phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It can't be--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's a cell phone, Amy. Definitely. .AMY But there's no signal out here. Eric can't get a signal. Reflexively, Eric pulls out his phone, checks again: nothing. There's another RING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It could be a different network. Something local.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Way down in that hole? How could it pick it up? Still another RING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What else can it be?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The RINGING falls SILENT. They all stand there, staring into the hole. A long beat, then it RESUMES. Eric CLAPS his hands, ecstatic. The others are starting to smile, too. Mathias moves to the windlass. He unrolls some of the rope, starts to wrap it around his chest. Jeff watches him. Another RING. The vine has taken root on the windlass:- the sawhorse, the barrel, the rope. Jeff steps forward, begins to yank it off, careful not to get the sap on his hands. He turns to Amy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a lamp in the orange tent. See if you can find some matches, too. Amy hurries off toward the orange tent, vanishing inside. There's a final RING, and then SILENCE again. Mathias is knotting the rope tightly around his chest. Amy returns, carrying an oil lamp, a box of matches. Everyone watches as Jeff crouches to light the lamp. Then he rises, turns toward Mathias, looks at him closely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) You sure? Mathias nods, takes the lamp, steps to the edge of the hole. Jeff and Eric move to the windlass; they position themselves at the hand crank, leaning into it, so the rope goes taut. Mathias girds himself, steps out over the hole. He dangles there for a moment, hanging beneath the sawhorse, the windlass GROANING on its mount. Then Jeff and Eric begin to reverse the crank, letting the rope slowly spool out. Stacy and Amy stand beside the shaft, peering into it, watching as Mathias begins his descent--ten feet, twenty feet, thirty feet down, and still only darkness beneath him, with no sign of the shaft's bottom. The windlass CREAKS as it turns; Jeff and Eric strain against it, sweating, muscles taut. Amy has turned from the shaft, is watching: the rope as it slowly unspools from the barrel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jeff. He turns to look, and she points at the rope, where it comes off the windlass and angles up toward the little wheel hanging from the sawhorse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) The sap... They'd cleared off most of the vine from the rope, but not all of it. Some of these remaining tendrils have been crushed as the windlass slowly unspools. Their sap is darkening the rope in spots, eating into it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) I think it's-- Jeff immediately turns back to the crank, his voice URGENT:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pull him up ! Eric hasn't grasped what's happening. He hesitates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amy jumps forward to help, all three of them pushing at the crank, getting in each other's way, the windlass CREAKING as it begins to turn again, slowly reclaiming the rope. Stacy remains beside the shaft, peering anxiously into it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mathias is twenty-five feet beneath us, just beginning to bump his way upward, swaying back and forth. He stares up at us, CONFUSED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it? The rope beneath the sawhorse is being visibly eaten away, its hemp unraveling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stacy turns toward the others, pointing, terrified.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The rope SWAPS. Jeff, Eric and Amy fall forward, the windlass spinning wildly behind them, free'of its weight. A long beat, then there's a distant, hollow-sounding THUMP, followed instantly by the POP of the lamp shattering. Stacy leans to peer into the shaft, her hand over her mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darkness. Silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Mathias...? Her voice ECHOES back at us. There's no response.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jeff, Eric, and Amy join Stacy at the edge of the shaft, all of them staring down into the darkness, looking horrified.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, Jesus. Oh, fuck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is he-- There's a GROAN from below, very faint, almost inaudible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's moaning. They listen for a beat, but there's only silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) I heard him moan. The others don't seem so certain; Jeff turns to the girls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) One of you will have to go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go? Jeff nods, waving into the shaft.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Down. We'll clear the vine off the rope. And you can--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why can't you? Or Eric?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have to work the crank. You won't be strong enough.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Amy and Stacy stare at each other; it's obvious neither of them wants to go. Stacy is the one who finally gives in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can do it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You sure? Stacy nods, but she doesn't look sure. She's hugging herself; it seems as if she might start trembling. Before anyone can speak, that GROANING comes from the shaft again, louder this time, unmistakable. Jeff cups his hands, SHOUTS:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mathias...? More SILENCE. Jeff turns to the girls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) See if you can find a knife. And another lamp.' He waves them toward the tents; then he and Eric begin to unspool the rope from the windlass, laying it out across the clearing in long, looping circles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Mayans keep coming: women now, too, bearing bundles on their backs. They're setting up a campsite along the edge of the jungle. The bald man stands in their midst, his hands on his hips, staring silently up the hillside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - OIL LAMP The SCRATCH of a match being lit: Amy's hand comes into frame, lifts the lamp's glass chimney, fires the wick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (0.S.) Just help him into the sling. Then we'll pull him up. The chimney is carefully replaced, as WE PULL BACK TO REVEAL:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amy is crouched, adjusting the lamp's flame. Jeff and Eric have mended the rope.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the excised lengths of spoiled hemp, and the ragged- looking knots on the rope itself, which has been spooled once more around the windlass. They've fashioned a sling at the rope's end. Jeff and Eric are helping Stacy into it, pulling it over her head, adjusting it under her armpits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Once we get him out, we'll drop the rope back down and pull you up, too. Amy offers Stacy the lamp. Stacy is scared, yet struggling not to show it. Her hands are trembling, and the lamp rattles as she takes it. The boys are stepping toward the windlass; Eric stops, glances back at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You okay? Stacy nods, but without much conviction. Eric steps toward her, gives her a tight hug. He holds her eyes for a moment, kisses her. Then he joins Jeff at the hand crank. They lean against it, and the rope goes taut. Stacy steps out into the open air over the shaft, the lamp in her right hand. With her left hand, she lunges, grabs at the sawhorse, clings tightly to it. Jeff glances toward her from the hand crank.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ready? She nods, but doesn't relinquish her grip on the sawhorse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) You have to let go, Stacy. For a moment, it doesn't seem like she'll be able to, but then--with a visible act of will--she does, and they slowly. begin to let the rope out, dropping her into the shaft.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - IN THE SLING She grips the sling with one hand, the lamp with the other. Wooden supports have been hammered into the walls of the shaft, buttressing the dirt. The vine clings to them, its leaves and flowers paler than on the hillside above. Stacy begins to swing, pendulum-like, as she descends. She tries unsuccessfully to steady herself, then glances up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're steadily dropping: thirty feet down, then forty. Amy is at the edge of the shaft, peering in at us. She waves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stacy smiles up at her. She starts to wave back, but is too scared to let go of the sling. She glances down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The light is swaying back and forth with Stacy, and it causes the shadows beneath us to jump and lurch. There's still no sign of the bottom; the windlass continues to CREAK. A beat, and then, very faintly, Mathias's dim shape starts to emerge: his white tennis shoes, his pale blue T-shirt. The lamp picks up bits of broken glass around his body.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stacy lifts the lamp, peering downward, struggling to see more clearly, and the sling suddenly jerks to a halt, making her SQUAWK. She looks up.
direction.name: direction
