direction.raw_text: The CREAKING has stopped. We're swinging slowly back and forth. WE SEE Amy peering down toward us: a long way up, almost seventy feet. A beat, then Jeff appears, too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stacy? His voice has an ECHO to it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - STACY Her face is slick with sweat; it shines-in the lamp light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.). It's the end of the rope.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not at the bottom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Can you see him? Stacy looks down again, holding up the lamp, peering toward Mathias's motionless body. She lifts her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A little.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Is he conscious?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't tell. I don't think so.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) How far are you above him? Stacy glances down once more, trying to quess,the distance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fifteen feet? (a beat) He's just lying there. She lifts her head again, peers upward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The top of the shaft is empty. Very faintly, WE HEAR Jeff and the others talking, just their voices, not their words.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Jeff ... ? Jeff's head reappears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have to figure out a way to lengthen the rope. We're gonna pull you up. He pulls his head away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - STACY She's staring upward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait! The rope has almost stopped its swaying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jeff steps back to the hole, peers into it. So does Amy. Eric waits by the windlass. The rope is completely played out. Stacy SHOUTS, her voice ECHOING slightly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) I want to stay with him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't. We have to--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) I'll jump. Jeff glances at the others. Eric shakes his head. Jeff
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: down to her:.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We might not be able to make it longer. You'll be trapped.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) What about him? We can't just leave him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll pull you up. Then we'll see. He starts toward the windlass again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - IN THE SLING The rope jerks, and she begins to rise. She kicks her legs, lifts her left arm over head, wrenches it free of the sling, so that only her right arm remains hooked. She switches the lamp from her right hand to her left, then slips completely free of,the sling, the lamp fluttering out as she drops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Almost totally dark, just a faint fall of light from above. Mathias is a dim shape on the floor of the shaft. Stacy lands beside him--heavily, awkwardly--the glass from his shattered lamp CRUNCHING beneath her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . She loses her balance, pitches forward, onto his body.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: makes a terrible SHRIEKING sound, pure pain, flailing his arms. Stacy struggles to right herself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry. Oh, God. I'm so sorry. She pulls herself into a crouch, staring down at him through the dimness, his SHRIEK fading to a steady MOANING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jeff, Amy, and Eric have rushed to the shaft; they're peering into it. There's only darkness beneath them. Eric SHOUTS:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stacy...? Stacy's voice rises toward them, sounding. very FAR AWAY:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) I didn't want him to be alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened to the lamp?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) It blew out. Jeff turns from the shaft, picks up the box of matches. He yanks off his shirt, ties the box inside it, then steps back to the edge of the hole. He CALLS down to Stacy:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm dropping the matches. Okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Okay. Jeff holds the knotted bundle over the shaft, lets it go. It falls into the darkness. A long beat, and then, very softly,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the thump as it lands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) (cont'd) Got it. The three of them stare into the hole, waiting for the light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's the RASP of a match, its flickering flame, then the stronger illumination of the lamp as Stacy lights its wick. Mathias lies on his back before her, silent now, motionless, his eyes shut. Stacy bends toward him, WHISPERS:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mathias...? He doesn't respond; it's hard to tell if he's conscious. Stacy lifts the lamp, peers about the shaft. The vine has taken root even at this depth, its flowers and leaves pale to the point of translucence. Beyond Mathias, there's an opening in the dirt wall, another shaft cutting perpendicularly into the earth. Its roof is supported by a stone archway, intricately carved. Stacy rises, as if to investigate, but then winces, nearly falls. She peers down at her right leg. A large piece of glass is imbedded there, just beneath her knee. it's the size of a playing card, gently concave,'dark with her blood. She reaches and, grimacing, pulls it from her body.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jeff is at the windlass, hurriedly cranking the rope back up. Eric and Amy stand watching.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We need fifteen feet. Twenty to be safe. No one speaks. The windlass turns with that steady CREAKING, but it's higher-pitched now, with no weight on the rope.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Come on. Think. How can we--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The clothes? From the backpacks? We could knot them together?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would they hold? Eric frowns, uncertain. Jeff finishes with the rope, stands there, catching his breath. Stacy's,voice rises toward them from the shaft:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) I cut my knee. Eric hurries to the shaft, followed by Jeff and Amy. They peer over its edge, toward Stacy, so far beneath them, in her flickering circle of lamp light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bad?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My shoe's full of blood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Put pressure on it. Use my shirt. They all stare down at her, waiting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stacy is crouched beside Mathias, pressing Jeff's T-shirt to her wound. Her khakis and tennis shoe are dark with blood; there's a lot of it. She isn't watching Mathias; he startles her when he opens his eyes and speaks:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My...legs... His voice is faint and RASPY; we can hear his pain in it. Stacy leans toward him, tries to smile reassuringly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't... move ...my...legs... Stacy turns to look: his legs are lying at an odd angle, as if he were a doll that had been carelessly tossed there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jeff, Eric and Amy, still watching; Jeff turns to the others.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about the tents? We could take one down, cut the nylon into strips. Eric and Amy glance toward the tents, debating.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would it be strong enough?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: we can braid them--three strips for each section. Then knot the sections together, for strength. Before either of them can respond, Stacy's voice emerges from the shaft, sounding SCARED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) I think he broke his back. They fall silent, staring down at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) (cont'd) He can't move his legs. And it smells.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Smells?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Like he lost his bowels. His bladder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (very quietly) Oh no. Please no. Jeff turns to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How can we make a backboard? Amy starts to shake her head, looking horrified.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, Jeff. No way. We can't move him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One of the frames from the backpacks? And the tent poles. There's tape in the orange tent. He doesn't wait for a response; he leans over the shaft,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) We have to builda backboard, Stacy. It might take a while.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . There's a long hesitation, as if Stacy is searching for some alternative. Then, still sounding FRIGHTENED and FARAWAY:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Okay. Amy is shaking her head, growing FRANTIC:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll make it worse. Well jostle him, and he'll-- Jeff turns toward her, with a hint of EXASPERATION:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can't just leave him down there. You know that, don't you? She starts to back away, toward the edge of the clearing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: we have to tell them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Mayans. We have to tell them what's happened. Jeff gives her an incredulous look. She keeps retreating; she's almost at the path.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) They can send for help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're not gonna---
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have to may. We have to-- She spins, starts off at a run, vanishing down the trail. Jeff calls after her, SHOUTING:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amy! But she's gone. Jeff turns to Eric.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Stay here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . And then he, too, is running.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Mayans have established their campsite on the edge of the jungle. Two women are beside a campfire, plucking a pair of chickens. WE SEE other campsites in the distance, other campfires, hugging the jungle's margin, surrounding the hill. Three men sit in the center of the clearing, facing the hillside, their bows in their laps. They rise suddenly, peering up the trail. The women pause in their labor, also staring. The campsite goes QUIET.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amy is sprinting toward us down the trail. Jeff is ten yards behind her, also running.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The three Mayans nock arrows. Two other men step forward to join them. One has a bow; the other is the bald Mayan, with the pistol. He unholsters it, and--as Amy reaches the bottom of the trail--raises it, aiming at her chest. Amy stops just short of the clearing: sweating, breathless, scared-looking. She lifts her hands, palms-up, beseeching.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Help us. Please. Someone's been hurt. He-- Jeff comes to a halt, five feet behind her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They can't understand you. She turns, her voice quickened with PANIC:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Say it in Spanish. Tell them he--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They don't speak Spanish.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Try it. You have to try.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . She spins back toward the Mayans, takes a step into the clearing. The bald man SHOUTS at her, a single short sentence in MAYAN. Amy holds out her hands to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Espanol? Habla Espanol? Jeff steps forward, grabs her elbow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They killed Henrich. Why would- Amy tries to tug free, but he won't let her. She starts to
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: at the Mayans:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Help usi We need help! The Mayans just stare at her, their weapons raised, their faces expressionless. one of them is much younger than the others, almost a boy. He says something in MAYAN to the bald man, and the bald man shakes his head. Amy begins to CRY. Jeff pulls at her elbow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have to get back. Amy turns toward him, her face smeared with tears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't want to come. I told you we shouldn't. I said-- Jeff tightens his grip on her arm, gives her a little shake, as if to wake her up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen to me. Mathias needs our help. Right now. He--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We shouldn't even be here. Why did you say we'd come? (she wipes at her tears) You have to do something. (rising toward a shout) You have to! It's your fault. It's all your-- Jeff shakes her again, more roughly, his voice like a slap:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: YD-q stepped onto the hill. Amy stares at him, startled into silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) They wouldn't have forced us up it if you hadn't. He holds her eyes, making sure she understands. Then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Now let's go, okay? He starts to pull her back toward the trail. She allows herself to be led; she's begun to CRY again:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't know. I just-- She's growing increasingly upset, almost SOBBING. She tries to turn back toward the Mayans again, but Jeff won't let her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) They have to help us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're not going to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They have to. She wrenches herself free, stumbles, falls into the vines beside the trail. Jeff reaches for her, but she kicks away from him, grabbing at the vines, scrambling to her feet. As she rises, she yanks up a tendril, a clot of earth hanging from its roots. She SCREAMS, spinning toward the clearing---
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ? --and throws the tendril at the Mayans. They scramble backward, with surprising panic, SHOUTING. The youngest of them is too slow: the length of vine hits him in the leg. He stares down at the tendril in shock. The others back hurriedly away from him. Two of them continue to point their weapons at Amy, but the bald man and one of the other bowmen are aiming at the young Mayan now. There's SHOUTING from the tree line. The entire campsite is on its feet; a woman begins to SCREAM.
direction.name: direction

result.ToD: WHY WON'T YOU FUCKING HELP US
result.heading: WHY WON'T YOU FUCKING HELP US

direction.raw_text: . She's in her,forties, short and stout, and she starts forward into the clearing, arms stretched toward the young Mayan. Two of the other women grab her, hold her back. The bald Mayan starts to ADDRESS the young man, pointing up the hillside. The short woman keeps SCREAMING, flailing, trying to break free. The young Mayan looks at her, then at the bald man. He speaks in MAYAN, a brief burst of words. The bald man shakes his head, points up the hill again, his pistol aimed at the young man's chest. The short woman is
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: eyes shut. The young Mayan takes a step toward her,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: what seems to be her name. The bald man SHOUTS at him, but the young Mayan ignores him, takes a second step, then a third. The bowmen are all aiming at him now, and suddenly, everyone seems to be YELLING. The young Mayan takes a fifth step, holding out his arms toward the WAILING woman, CALLING to her. The bald man
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: shooting him in the head. At the same instant, the bowmen let their arrows fly, the shafts THUMPING into the young man's chest, burying themselves to the fletches. The clearing goes still; the only sound is the woman's steady
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Then the bald man swings his pistol toward Amy and Jeffs he SHOUTS in MAYAN at them. The other Mayans nock fresh arrows, draw their bows. Jeff takes a step backward, half-raising his hands. Amy just stands there, her eyes on the young Mayan's motionless body.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... (no reaction)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . She turns, finally. She looks horrified, stupefied; her hands are burned a deep red from the vine's sap. Jeff waves her up the hill. She stares at him for another beat, and then, without a word, starts to climb the trail. Jeff hesitates, watching the Mayans: the bloodied corpse, the raised weapons, the KEENING woman. Then he, too, turns and hurries off up the trail.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amy, Jeff, and Eric have taken down the blue tent; its contents lie tumbled in a pile in the little clearing. All three of them look sun struck, sweat-stained, worn out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Eric is using a knife to cut long strips from the blue nylon. Amy is braiding three of the strips together. Jeff has one of the backpack frames, the roll of duct tape, and some of the poles from the tent; he's making a backboard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe we could use it as a weapon, you know? Wrap it around some stones or something. And throw them, like grenades. I mean, if they're that scared of it-- Jeff tears off a piece of tape with his teeth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They have guns, Eric. And bows. What do you think they'll do if we start throwing the vine at them? Eric is silenced by this. He cuts another long strip of nylon, passes it to Amy. But he can't seem to stop himself from talking:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . So you figure it's, what? Sacred or something? Like, you touch it and you have to die? Amy begins to cry suddenly--a SOB, quickly suppressed. Jeff and Eric both turn to look at her. The vine's sap has scarred her hands and arms almost to the elbows. She wipes her eyes, takes a deep breath, shakes her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm okay. But she doesn't look it. Jeff removes his hat, holds it out. Amy just stares at it; he nods for her to take it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on. You're burning. She reaches for the hat, puts it on, then wipes at her eyes again. Jeff leans forward, touches her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) We're gonna get through this. All right? We'll pull them up. And then ...I don't know--we'll figure things out. it has to rain at some point. And maybe we can snare some birds. Or--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The electronic RINGING sounds once more from the bottom of the shaft. They all turn to stare.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The oil lamp has begun to smoke, adding a haze to the light. Stacy is beside Mathias, holding his hand. She's still pressing Jeff's shirt to her wound. The RING sounds again. Mathias turns his head, peers toward the shaft cut into the dirt wall to his left: that's where it's coming from. Stacy reaches to pick up the lamp, rises to her feet. Another
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Jeff SHOUTS down from above:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Stacy...? Stacy ignores him; she limps around Mathias, starts toward the opening. She hesitates at the mouth of the shaft, lifting her lamp to see better. There's another RING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -- INTO THE SHAFT The lamp's light doesn't penetrate very far, but WE can SEE that the vine has taken root here with great avidity: it grows thickly on the walls, floor and roof. There's a steady draft coming toward us, and the plant shifts in it, RUSTLING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stacy stands there, looking scared. There's another RING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Can you see it? Stacy lifts her head, SHOUTS:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. She keeps peering into the shadows, not moving. The ringing falls SILENT. Stacy turns, hobbles back toward Mathias, and the light shudders, dims for a moment. She squints at it: the oil is nearly gone. She SHOUTS up to the others:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) The lamp's almost out of oil.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Then blow it out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Stacy seems terrified by this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Blow it out?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (0.5.) We'll need it when we come down. To get him on the backboard. Stacy drops into a crouch beside Mathias, sets the lamp down before her, stares at it. She clearly doesn't want to blow it out. Mathias watches her, silent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) (cont'd) All right? Stacy leans forward, lifts the lamp's glass chimney, blows out the flame, dropping the shaft into darkness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The.sun is just touching the horizon, the sky turning red. Th ey've tied the braids of nylon onto the rope, attached the finished backboard to them. It rests beside the shaft, padded with one-of the archaeologist's sleeping bags. Jeff and Eric remove their belts, drop them onto the backboard. They step to the windlass, lean against its hand crank, the rope going taut. Amy stands by the shaft, gathering her courage. Then she reaches for the backboard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mathias and Stacy are two dim shapes in the darkness. The windlass begins its CREAKING. A long beat, and then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Stacy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (0.5.) Light the lamp! Stacy shifts; once again, there's the RASP of a match, then the stronger illumination of the lamp as she lights its wick. Mathias's eyes are shut; there's a deep RAGGEDNESS to his breathing. Stacy looks upward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The backboard is dropping toward us. Above it, the light is already fading from the sky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stacy rises to her feet, lifting the lamp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - CROUCHING ON THE BACKBOARD She's dropping slowly down the shaft, clenching the nylon braids, her eyes tightly shut: terrified. The backboard sways, pendulum-like, as it descends, almost touching the vine-covered walls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When the backboard comes within reach, Stacy grabs it, pulling it to the-right, so that it will come to rest at Mathias's side. But then, with three feet still to go, it jerks to a halt, almost toppling Amy from her perch. A beat, and Jeff's voice comes toward them from above:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Have you reached them?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Almost. A few more feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.} How many? Amy leans, peers down at Mathias's broken body.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. Three?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.} we're out of rope. (a beat) Can you still do it? Amy looks at Stacy; neither speaks. Finally, QUIETLY:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll have to send it back up, I guess.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Amy doesn't answer. She shifts her weight, and the backboard starts to swing. Stacy reaches to steady it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Blow out the lamp. Wait here in the dark. Amy is silent, staring down at Mathias's still form; it's obvious she doesn't want to do this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Or we could try to lift him, maybe. More silence. Stacy persists:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) One of us at his shoulders. The other his feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If he twists--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's only a few feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Once more, Amy is silent. Stacy lifts the lamp, examining it, the diminishing pool of oil.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'.d) We have to decide. The light's not going to last. Jeff's voice comes toward them from above again:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Amy...? They both look up; the sky has grown too dark to see him. Amy hesitates one beat more, then YELLS:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're gonna try itt She climbs off the backboard, crouches beside Mathias. Stacy sets down the lamp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Mathias...? She touches his shoulder, and he opens his eyes, stares at her. He looks haggard, ashen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) We're going to lift you, okay? We're going to hoist you up and out. Mathias stares from her to the backboard to Stacy. He shuts his eyes. Amy stands up, drags the belts off the backboard, drops them next to the lamp. She positions herself behind Mathias's head; Stacy hobbles to his feet, limping.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) His hips. Stacy hesitates, looking doubtful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You sure?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you lift from his feet, he'll bend at the waist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But if I lift at his hips, won't he arch his back? They both stare down at Mathis, imagining these two different scenarios. Amy glances toward the lamp, its dwindling oil.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His knees. Stacy crouches by Mathias's knees, a little off balance, favoring her wounded leg. Amy bends, sliding her hands under his shoulders. Mathias GROANS, and Stacy starts to pull away, but Amy shakes her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Quickly. On three. They count together:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One ... two.-,.three. They lift, and Mathias immediately starts to SCREAM. His body sags at the waist; he begins to thrash his arms. Stacy starts to set him down, but Amy shakes her head, SHOUTS:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Stacy's wounded leg is hindering her; she can't keep up with Amy. Mathias's shoulders are level with the backboard, but his knees are still a good foot beneath it. He keeps
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The bend at his waist increases.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Lift I Stacy tries to hoist him higher, lunging, his torso twisting, his SCREAMS going LOUDER. His right arm, hits the backboard, sends it swinging. The girls toss him toward it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The sun has set. There's a half moon, giving us just enough light to dimly see Eric and Jeff peering into the shaft. Mathias's SCREAMS echo up toward them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mathias has fallen silent. He lies on the backboard, eyes clenched, sweat beading his forehead. Stacy is trying not to cry. She watches Amy buckle the two belts together, then drape them over Mathias's chest, knot them tight. Amy strips off her own belt, gestures for Stacy to do the same. She buckles these together, too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have to pee. She limps toward the wall, lowers her pants, gingerly crouches. She stares toward the other shaft as she pees: its stone archway, the shifting shadows, the vine rustling softly in the steady draught. Amy binds Mathias at his thighs. She WHISPERS to him:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You okay? She waits, but he doesn't respond. His eyes remain shut. Stacy rises, buttoning her pants, limps back toward Amy. She's on the edge of tears, is working hard to fight them off. Amy lifts her head, SHOUTS up to Jeff:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Pull him up!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A moment's pause, then the windlass begins to CREAK once more. The backboard slowly rises, swaying gently. They watch it climb away from them. Amy holds out her-hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Here. Stacy just stares at her, not understanding. Amy nods at the lamp: the oil is gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) It's gonna go out. And it's true: as Stacy reaches for Amy's hand, the light suddenly flickers, dims, drops them into darkness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Mayans are settling into sleep at their campsite. Three of the men remain on guard duty in the clearing, facing the hillside, their backs to the fire. The young Mayan's corpse still lies in the dirt, fifteen feet in front of them. The firelight throws shadows across his bloodied body.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The windlass CREAKS loudly as Eric and Jeff work to wind in the rope. Stacy has already been pulled up from the hole. She's sitting beside Mathias, who's lying on the backboard, on the edge of the clearing, by the orange tent. Amy emerges from the shaft, dangling beneath the sawhorse. Jeff holds the rope taut while Eric steps to the hole, pulls Amy toward him. Stacy watches from beside the backboard. Mathias's eyes are shut, his breathing ROUGH with phlegm. No one speaks. Once Amy is free of the sling, they all move to the backboard. Eric takes Stacy's-hand; Jeff crouches, starts to undo the belts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shouldn't we carry him into the tent first? Jeff pulls free the first belt, shifts to the second one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's gonna keep leaking urine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But we can't just leave him out in the open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll rig a shelter. With what's left of the blue tent. Jeff pulls the second belt free. Mathias's eyes remain shut.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) One of us should stay on watch while the others sleep. Two hour shifts. He reaches for his knapsack, unzips it. He pulls out a liter bottle of water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) .Once it's light, we'll figure out how much water we have, and how to ration it. Food, too. For now, I think we should each just take a single swig. He uncaps the bottle, hands it to Amy. He watches her drink from it. When she's done, she passes it to Stacy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Eric and I'll build the shelter,. then I'll take the first shift. You two should try to sleep. Stacy takes her single sip, passes the bottle to Eric.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stacy and Amy have pushed the camping supplies into a pile along the tent's rear wall. Stacy pulls off her pants, bends to examine her wound in the darkness. Amy is beside her, lying on her side. A beat of silence. Then, WHISPERING:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amy? what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We shouldn't have lifted him, should we? Amy reaches, pats Stacy's hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's never gonna walk again.. He's--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't, Stacy. Don't talk. It'll only make things worse. Stacy falls silent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Just go to sleep, okay? Let's try to go to sleep. Stacy lies down next to Amy, in her-underwear and T-shirt. They huddle close together in the darkness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eric is building a tiny lean-to for Mathias, using the duct tape, the leftover nylon and poles from the blue tent. Jeff crouches over the backboard. He starts to cut Mathias's jeans off him with the knife. Mathias's eyes remain shut.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What're you doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have to keep him clean. He slices the jeans, from ankle to hip, first one leg, then the other, struggling not to jostle Mathias's body.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) That's how it'll happen, I think. if it does.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If what does? Jeff slides the soiled strips of-denim out from under Mathias's body, tosses them aside. He LOWERS his voice:.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If he dies here. infection. Blood poisoning--something like that. Eric seems startled by this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think he's gonna die?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (he shrugs) His back is broken. Who knows what else. Eric is silent, motionless, the tape in his hand. Mathias's
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: seems to be getting steadily worse. Jeff bends to cut off his boxers, first one leg, then the other. He tosses the soiled fabric aside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) We should go back down in the morning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Down?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Into the shaft. Try to find the phone again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's no oil for the lamp. Jeff waves toward the orange tent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's tequila. We could pour it on some of the clothes, tie them around one of these poles, make a torch. A sleeping bag is lying in the clearing among the strips of nylon and aluminum poles. Jeff steps over to pick it up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Without the phone, he's dead. If we have to wait for someone to come searching... He shakes his head. Then he leans forward and carefully drapes the sleeping bag across Mathias's broken body.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The orange nylon is just starting to glow with the sun's arrival. Stacy and Eric lie beneath one of the sleeping bags, Eric's head on her shoulder. Jeff lies curled on his side, a few feet away, still shirtless. Jeff's eyes open. He sits up, stares about, then reaches for one of the backpacks. He quietly digs through it till he finds a T-shirt. He sniffs at it, then pulls it on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mathias lies on his backboard, eyes shut, his breathing still sounding THICK WITH PHLEGM. Amy sits beside him, hunched into herself, half drowsing. She lifts her head as Jeff emerges from the tent, stares at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How is he?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The same.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (she shrugs) Tired. Thirsty. Hungry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Once the others are up, we'll have some water. His face is stubbled, sweat-stained. He looks ragged; they both do. He steps to the opposite side of the clearing, unzips, begins to urinate, with his back to Amy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The vine covers everything, tangled and matted, with those odd, knoll-like growths scattered among it. The nearest-is thirty feet away. its leaves are swaying slightly in a faint breeze, and WE SEE a flash of yellowish white beneath them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jeff finishes, shakes, zips, then steps out into the vine, wading toward the tiny mound. Amy remains beside the backboard; she watches him crouch, part the tendrils, stare.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it? Jeff gestures for her to approach. When she reaches him, he leans forward, pulls aside the vines. WE SEE a man's skull, a loose tumble of bones. Amy INHALES sharply, recoiling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bodies. All of them. He waves across the hilltop, at the other mounds: there are more than a dozen. Amy takes them in. The light is gaining strength, the green leaves seeming to shine in it, the red flowers to glow. Jeff's face assumes a puzzled expression.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Where are the birds?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Birds?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: it's dawn--there should be birds. They both stare off across the hillside: so quiet, so still.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stacy opens her eyes. She lies there, struggling to orient herself, with Eric on her shoulder. She starts to roll onto her side, then stops, looking confused. She reaches under the sleeping bag, toward her leg, her confusion changing to alarm. She site up, jarring Eric awake, and throws back the sleeping bag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What...? The vine has grown dramatically during the night, reaching out from the pile of supplies at the rear of the tent to spread across Stacy's right leg, almost to her waist. She sits up, tries to push it off her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh my god... The vine is clinging to her; she has to tear it, the sap shining slickly on her hands, visibly beginning to burn the skin. She yanks at the tendrils, tossing them aside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Help me. Eric sits up, still only half-awake. He just stares.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd). It's inside me... It's true: one of the tendrils has pushed its way into the wound on her leg, widening it, thrusting itself a full three inches into her body, like a thick finger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont.'d) Oh, Jesus--it's fucking inside me. She tries to pull the tendril out, but she's too panicky, too quick, and the vine breaks, leaving a piece of itself snagged under her skin. Stacy starts to SCREAM:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Get the knifes Eric is too shocked to stir. He's staring down at her leg, at the bulge beneath her skin: it looks as if it's moving.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stacy's SCREAMING continues. Jeff and Amy are on their feet, hurrying across the clearing. Mathias has opened his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Get the knife! Jeff bends, scoops up the knife, starts toward the tent. He waves toward Mathias.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stay with him. Then he ducks in through the tent's flap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eric is beside Stacy, trying to calm her; she's started to
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Her hands and wrists have turned a dark red, and the tendril is inside her leg, just to the left of her shin, running parallel to it. Jeff steps. toward them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The vine. It's inside her. Stacy points to her wound, SOBBING now:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cut it out. You gotta cut it out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The blade's dirty. We should-- Stacy starts shaking her head, FRANTIC:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's moving! Can't you see? Jeff stares at the bulge, hesitating. Then it moves, unquestionably: contracting and expanding, like a worm. Stacy SHRIEKS:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Jeff! Be gives in, crouching over her leg.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's gonna hurt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please. Hurry. He leans forward, slices into the skin above the bulge. Stacy CRIES OUT, starts to jerk away, but Jeff presses down on her leg, holding her still. He reaches into her wound with his finger, digs out the piece of vine, tosses it aside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get me a shirt or something. He gestures toward the backpacks, and Eric unzips one of them, starts to dig through it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He pulls out a T-shirt, hands it to Jeff. Jeff wads it up, uses it to put pressure on the incision, staunching the flow of blood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amy is crouched by the backboard, watching the tent, trying to grasp what's happening. Mathias startles her by speaking:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Something's... wrong... His voice is thick-sounding, very faint. Amy tries to soothe him; she puts her hand on his shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's okay. It's just--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: my-legs...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know. You're hurt. But we're., gonna get you--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Show ...me... He's struggling to rise, straining upward. Amy tries to stop him, pressing down on his shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shh. But he fights her; he won't be quieted:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Show-me... So she leans, lifts the sleeping bag off him. His lower legs are completely covered by the flowering vine, from the knees down. Amy and Mathias both stare in surprise. Then Amy reaches, starts to yank the tendrils free.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jeff is leaning forward, pressing the balled-up T-shirt against Stacy's wound, the blood darkening the fabric. Stacy is lying there, her eyes shut, fists clenched.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can still feel it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Jeff shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got it out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can feel it moving.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's just your body. Your muscle twitching.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's on our clothes. Stacy and Jeff both glance at him. There's a faint, almost fungus-like green growing on his shirt, an infantile version of the vine covering the hillside all around them. It's on all of them: their shirts, their pants, their shoes. Before any of them can respond to this development, Amy starts to CALL from the clearing, sounding SCARED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Jeff...? They all turn toward the flap. Mathias begins to SCREAM. Amy's voice JUMPS in volume:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) (cont'd) of .I Jeff rises, moves toward the flap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amy is crouched over Mathias, frantically yanking the vines off him. Mathias is struggling impotently to sit up. He continues to SCREAM, staring down at his legs. Jeff emerges-from the tent, hurries to help Amy, both of them tearing at the vine, a flash of white appearing beneath the green, shiny and bright: bones. Mathias's legs have been stripped completely clean of flesh from the knee down. As they keep pulling the tendrils free, blood starts to drip from Mathias's knees, slowly at first, but then suddenly spurting, spraying them: their chests, their faces. Amy jerks backward, GAGGING, RETCHING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . She jumps up, takes three steps into the center of the clearing, and VOMITS, her hands on her knees. She wipes at the blood on her face, COUGHS, spits, then bends again, another long ribbon of puke slipping free of her. Mathias continues to SCREAM and thrash. Jeff reaches for the belts, lying in the dirt beside the backboard. He quickly ties first one then another around Mathias's legs, twisting them into tourniquets, cutting off the flow of blood. Stacy and Eric stoop out through the tent's flap: they stand there staring, struggling to grasp what's happened. Stacy is in her underwear and T-shirt, blood still seeping down her leg. Amy turns to face them. Mathias is WEEPING now, his eyes shut. The hemorrhaging has stopped; blood lies in puddles across the backboard. Jeff is covered with it. And then there are the bones: so white, so wet-looking, from the knees down, nothing but bone. Suddenly, Stacy starts to SCREAM, pointing past Amy, at the dirt beyond her. They all turn to look. The vine is in motion, a long tendril slipping into the clearing, moving snakelike toward the puddle of vomit at Amy's feet. Amy backs quickly away. A second tendril emerges from the low wall of green around the clearing, then a third. They move rapidly, as if racing each other; both of them slipping alongside the first into the little pool of vomit. The tendrils absorb the puke, draining it, until all that's left is a damp shadow on the rocky soil. Then they withdraw back across the clearing, silently retreating into the larger mass of green. Stacy keeps SCREAMING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Faintly, from up the hill, WE HEAR Stacy's screams. The Mayans are finishing their morning meal. They eat in silence, showing no reaction to the sound. In the clearing, the young Mayan's corpse is buried beneath a thick growth of vine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .. HILLTOP - THE CLEARING - DAY The four of them are sitting by the orange tent. Jeff and Amy are still spattered and smeared with Mathias's blood; Stacy is still in her underwear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . e.- Jeff is inventorying their food and water. The others watch as he puts the perishables in a separate pile: two bananas, a plastic bag ofgrapes going brown, an orange, a soggy tuna fish sandwich.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They must've dug it up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who? He arranges the rest of the food in a second pile: a bag of pretzels, a can of nuts, two protein bars, a box of raisins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The miners. He puts the liquids in a third pile: three bottles of water, two of iced tea, a can of Coke. That's all there is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) And then the Mayans cleared the jungle around the hill, I guess. To keep it quarantined. That's why they won't let us leave, don't you think? They're afraid we'll spread it? The others are silent. Jeff reaches for the tuna fish sandwich. He carefully unwraps it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Or else...I don't know. Maybe it's something religious? And we're some sort of sacrifice? He glances at the others, but once again no one responds. They all look dazed: knocked back into themselves. Jeff picks up the knife, wipes it on his jeans.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) They must've done the same thing with the archaeologists. And Henrich. Trapped them here. Like us. He cuts the sandwich into four equal sections.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) And then somehow it killed them off. All of them. one by one. This is too much for Eric; he.leaps up, looking panicky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have to find the phone. We have to go back down and-- Jeff makes a calming motion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll eat first. Drink some water. We have to stay calm. Not rush at things. He holds out one of the tiny squares of sandwich. Eric hesitates, then accepts it, dropping back into a crouch. Jeff hands Amy her square.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about Mathias? She nods toward him, and they all turn to look. From his knees down, Mathias's legs are nothing but bone, tendon, and ropy clots of blackened blood. His face looks gray. His eyes are shut, and his breathing sounds terribly RAGGED.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He wouldn't be able to stomach it. Jeff offers Stacy her ration. She takes it, but almost absentmindedly. She seems distracted; she keeps prodding at her wound with her fingertip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Stop it, Stacy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's still in there. I can feel it. She keeps probing. Jeff shakes his head, a little it' ATIENT:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told you. I got it out. Jeff pops his square of sandwich into his mouth; Eric and Amy eat theirs, too. Stacy's ration remains in her hand; she seems to have forgotten it. She's sunburned, sweat-stained, glassy-eyed. Eric leans toward her, looking worried.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eat, Stacy. You have to eat. She places the tiny sandwich into her mouth, chews, swallows, staring at her wound the whole time. Then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See? How puffy it is?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's just swelling. It's natural. (he turns toward Jeff) Right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (he nods) It's what happens when you get hurt. Jeff picks up one of the water bottles, twists off its-cap. He offers the bottle to Stacy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) one swallow apiece. The bottle makes its way around their little circle. When it returns to Jeff, he takes his sip, caps the bottle. Eric is watching Stacy, her anxious probing; he looks increasingly distressed by it. He jumps up again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The phone. Let's find the phone. Jeff doesn't move. Stacy's bloodied khakis. are lying in the dirt beside him, and he reaches for them, starts to cut off their legs with the knife, just above the knee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We need to take care of Mathias, first. He won't last much longer like that. Amy looks appalled; she makes a shushing motion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shh. They all glance toward Mathias again. He lies there, eyes shut, breathing in and out with that fluid-filled RASP. He seems to be unconscious, but Jeff still LOWERS his voice:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have to cut them off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cut what off?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His legs. He's finished with Stacy's khakis; they've been transformed into a pair of shorts. He tosses them toward her. Eric and Amy are staring at him, shocked into silence. Then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're joking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He'll die if we don't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Without anaesthesia?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There won't be any pain. He has no feeling beneath his waist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He'll lose too much blood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The tourniquets are already in place. We'll cut below them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With what? Jeff holds up the knife. Eric SCOFFS at the idea:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) That wouldn't do a thing. You'd need a bone saw.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We could break the bones. Then cut. Amy is shaking her head; she looks mortified.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, Jeff. No way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about infection? Cutting into him with a dirty knife?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll sterilize it. Build a fire. Heat the blade in the flames. It'll cauterize as it cuts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll kill him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Or save him. One or the other. We can't just--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cut me first. Right here. Stacy has stood up, pulled on the shorts Jeff has fashioned for her. She's bent over, pointing at a spot on her leg, a few inches below the last incision.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cent'd) Sterilize the knife and-- Eric steps toward her, tries to soothe her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's nothing there, Stacy. It's
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She hardly seems to hear him. She's frightened, growing a little wild with it. Her voice comes FAST AND HIGH:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's moving. I can feel it moving.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're imagining it. You're scared, and you--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I gotta get out of here. I gotta get to a hospital. I gotta-- Eric takes her hand, squeezing it. Stacy blinks at him, close to tears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have to calm down. Can you do that? Can you try to calm down? Stacy pulls free of him, drops into a crouch, hugging her knees to her chest, her eyes shut.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See if there's a signal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your phone. Check your phone. Eric doesn't move: he knows there's no point.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Check it. Eric SIGHS, steps to his pack, crouches to remove his phone. He flips it open, holds it out to Stacy. She stares down at it: there's no signal. Eric drops it back into his pack. Then he turns to Jeff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We go back down. We find the other phone. We call for help. That's how we get out of here. That's how we save him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It'11 take too long.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One call, Jeff. They'll be here by sundown.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And Mathias will already be dying. You understand? There's no flesh covering his bones. They're-- Mathias's voice interrupts him, from the backboard. Very
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: barely audible:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do...it... They all turn, stare toward him. His eyes are open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Please... (a beat) Cut... them... off... He slowly, painfully, extends his left hand toward them, a beseeching gesture.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - SMALL PILE OF CLOTHES A pair of shorts, a woman's blouse, two black socks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) I'll have to break the bones first. An amber liquid is being poured onto the clothes, very slowly. WE PULL BACK TO REVEAL:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eric is crouched, dribbling the tequila onto the clothes, pausing to let it soak in, saturating the fabric. Jeff is kneeling by the backboard, talking to Mathias.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With the stone. Then I'll use the knife to cut. A large stone sits beside the pile of clothes, shaped like an ax head. There's the knife, too, and the metal canteen from the orange tent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) We'll heat the canteen, and cauterize the wounds with it. To stop the bleeding. Eric strikes a match: the clothes catch instantly, burning with a low blue flame. He sets the knife in the fire, then the stone, and splashes more tequila on them. The girls stand in the center of the clearing, watching.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) You shouldn't be able to feel a thing. But you can bite this if you want. Just in case. He holds up one of the belts. Mathias hesitates, then opens his mouth, and Jeff sets it carefully inside. Mathias clamps down, gripping it between his teeth. Jeff glances at Eric.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Ready? Eric nods.- The stone is making a cracking sound in the fire, glowing a.deep red. Jeff turns back to Mathias.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) You? Mathias also nods, shutting his eyes. There's a small towel in the dirt beside Jeff, and he. picks it up, wrapping it around his hand. He looks over his shoulder at the girls. They both seem terrified, shaky with it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) You should wait in the tent. Amy starts to shake her head, but then Stacy is in motion, grabbing her hand, pulling her across the clearing, and she lets herself be led. Jeff watches them vanish through the flap, then reaches toward the fire with his towel-swathed hand. He scoops up the stone, raises it over his head, SLAMS it down with all his strength against the exposed bones of Mathias's left leg. Mathias bucks, GROANING; his eyes jump open. Jeff drops the stone back into the fire,. snatches out the knife. Mathias is trying to rise onto his elbow, straining to see what's happening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Hold him. Eric sets the canteen into the flames, sloshes some tequila on it, then shifts.to the backboard. He presses down on Mathias''s shoulders. Mathias is WHIMPERING, twisting his head back and forth, gripping the belt tightly in his teeth. Jeff starts to saw with the knife, chopping and cutting the splintered bones. Bloody marrow spills wetly out, and then Mathias's.lower leg comes free of his body, the foot and ankle and shin bones completely separate now. Jeff lifts the bones away, drops them into the dirt beside the backboard. Then he turns, uses the towel to pluck the canteen out of the fire: it, too, is glowing red. He presses the canteen flat against Mathias's stump, the flesh SIZZLING and SPITTING. Mathias bucks even more forcefully; he spits out the belt, CRIES OUT:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop...stop... Jeff ignores him, dropping the canteen back into the fire, lifting out the stone. Eric looks increasingly mortified; he seems close to tears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Reep him still. He turns, SMASHES the stone into Mathias's right leg. Mathias begins to SCREAM, bucking against Eric's grip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mathias's SCREAMS fill the tent. Amy and Stacy are sitting together, clutching each other; Stacy is CRYING. Amy is staring toward the flap with a look of horror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jeff saws and chops at the shattered bones with the knife. Mathias continues'to SCREAM. Eric is using all his weight to hold him still, his head averted, his eyes clenched shut. Jeff lifts the severed bones.away from the backboard, drops them at his side. Then he scoops up the canteen again. As he presses it to Mathias's stump, Mathias finally passes out, his body going slack, his screams falling SILENT. For a long beat, there's just the SPITTING, SNAPPING sound of Mathias's flesh being seared. Then Eric pulls back into a crouch, shaking his head, looking utterly depleted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, Jesus. Jesus Christ. Amy emerges from the tent, then Stacy. They stand staring.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He felt it, didn't he? The whole thing. Jeff lifts the canteen away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He couldn't have.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was screaming. Be was telling you to stop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was just seeing it. Looking down, and-- Amy is shaking her head, staring at Mathias with that appalled expression: his slack face, his burned stumps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is bad, Jeff. So bad. Jeff leans to loosen first one tourniquet, then the other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We've bought him some time. He wouldn't have--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You cut off his legs! You-- Stacy SCREAMS, pointing toward Mathias's amputated limbs. They're lying in the dirt at the base of the backboard, the bloodstained bones held together with a few remaining cords of flesh. A vine has come snaking into the clearing: it's wrapping itself around one of the feet. As the tendril begins to drag. the bones away, a.second one slithers forward and lays claim to the other foot. Eric grabs the knife, jumps up, steps on the first tendril, bends to slash at it with the blade. He swoops toward the second one. Even as he does so, though, a third tendril slithers into the clearing, then a fourth. Stacy SCREAMS again, short and loud, and backs toward the tent; Eric bends and slashes, bends and slashes, and the'vine keeps coming, from all directions, reaching for the bones.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leave it. Eric ignores him, cutting and stomping and tearing at the tendrils, faster and faster, but still too slow, the vine fighting back, wrapping itself around his legs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Eric. He steps toward him, grabs his arm, pulls him away. They stand side by side, watching as the vine pulls the severed limbs into itself, the white of the bones vanishing into the larger mass of green. Stacy has begun to CRY again. There's a beat of stillness, and then, once more, echoing up toward them from the shaft, comes that faint electronic
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of the cell phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - THE WINDLASS Spinning, the rope spooling quickly off the barrel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) I don't know how long it'11 burn--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eric is pulling the rope off the windlass, laying it out in a long zigzag across the clearing. Jeff is crouched by the shaft, making a torch. The girls stand over him, watching.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you'll have to be quick. He has one of the aluminum poles from the blue tent. He's wrapped duct tape around its bottom for a grip, tied some of the archaeologists' clothes around the top. He's dribbling tequila on the knot of fabric, saturating it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Wait to light it till you're both down there. Then--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who? Jeff looks up at her, startled by the question. Eric is moving along the length of rope, bent low, checking its hemp for signs of weakness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's going?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You and Amy. They all look bad, but Stacy looks the worst: her wounded leg,, -her greasy hair, a panicky edge to every gesture. She shakes her head, with vehemence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, Jeff. No way. Not me. Jeff caps the tequila bottle, gives Stacy a tired look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We've already been through this. Eric and I need to work the winch. You're not strong enough. Eric has reached the end of the rope; he stands up, wiping his hands on his pants.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's clear. He moves to the windlass, starts to wind the rope back onto the barrel. They've tied a sling on the rope's end again. Stacy is pressing her right hand against the bottom of her rib cage: massaging, probing
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why can't Amy go on her own?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The torch won't last that long. We need you both there, searching. Stacy starts shaking her head again, TERRIFIED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not going. I can't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't have a choice, Stacy. Amy can see where this is headed; she tries to divert it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's okay. I'll go alone. Jeff ignores this. He rises to his feet, still focused on Stacy. WE can HEAR his growing anger in his voice:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: if we don't find the phone, Mathias will die. Understand? Stacy is silent, hugging herself, staring at the ground. Eric has finished winding the rope onto the windlass. He tries to intervene:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jeff ignores him, his gaze on Stacy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So that's what you're saying. Just to be clear. That you're not willing to help him live.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, man. She's too scared.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't give a fuck. I'm scared, too. We all are.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: it was inside her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And we got it out. Now she needs to stop being such a fucking baby, stop being so selfish, and-- Eric is stepping toward him suddenly, right up against him, forcing him back a step.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ,hut Up. Okay? He's bigger than Jeff, stronger, and this is suddenly very palpable. Their faces are three inches apart. A tense beat, and then, more QUIETLY:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) You're being too hard. Jeff gives him a look of incredulity, almost disgust.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hard?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just leave her be. Jeff turns away from him, from all three of them. He stares off across the hill for a beat, then shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm the only one thinking. I'm carrying the whole fucking load.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So stop. Lay it down. Jeff turns back to him, gives him a look of pure contempt; WE can HEAR his fury rising again as he speaks:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This isn't just going to work out on its own, Eric. You know? Magically?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not saying--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We could end up dead here. All of us. Is that what you want?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then get the fuck out of my way, and start helping me. He holds Eric's eyes long enough to confirm that Eric isn't going to protest, then he glances past him at Stacy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) You going or not? Stacy-is still staring at the ground, her hand probing at her chest. It's clear she doesn't want to go, but Jeff has shamed her into silence. Amy reaches, touches her arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .'-11 be right there. Okay? We'll be together the whole time. A long beat, then Stacy manages a nod. It's enough for Jeff; he pushes past Eric, moving toward the windlass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get in the sling, Amy. Amy turns, reaching for the sling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A faint fall of light from above. There's the CREAKING of the windlass: Amy is dropping slowly toward us. When her feet touch the bottom of the shaft, she scrambles out of the sling. Then she lifts her head, SHOUTS:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pull it up! The CREAKING resumes. She stands there in the dimness, watching the sling rise away from her. She has the makeshift torch in one hand, the box of matches in the other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eric is helping Stacy into the sling, pulling it over her head; Stacy's hands are shaking badly. Eric hugs her, trying to calm her. Jeff waits beside the hand crank.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amy is in a crouch. She keeps glancing toward the stone arch cut into the shaft's wall, and the passageway beyond it: the vine dangles from.the low ceiling, like streamers at a party. The CREAKING resumes, and Amy looks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stacy is dropping slowly toward us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amy glances toward the arch again. A slight draft blows steadily from it, and the vine shifts and trembles in it. A beat, then the RINGING starts up once more. It's coming from within the shadowed passageway. Amy opens the box of matches, plucks one out. She's too jumpy, though; her hands are-trembling so much that she shakes the match out as soon as it's lit. There's a second RING. Stacy has nearly reached us. Amy digs another match from the box. Stacy's feet touch the bottom of the shaft; she yanks off the sling. There's a third RING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hurry. Amy strikes the match, holds it to the knot of clothing at the end of the aluminum pole. The alcohol catches with a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sound, a cloud of pale blue fire materializing around the torch. Amy lifts it, and they start into:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stacy is in front, with Amy right behind her. The torch shudders weakly in the steady draft; the shaft's ceiling is low enough that they have to crouch as they move forward. There's a fourth RING, drawing them deeper down the passage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The tendrils hanging from the ceiling brush against them. The vine is growing on the floor, too--knee-deep--and from the walls on either side. Amy is moving cautiously, squinting into the darkness, and Stacy starts to pull ahead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait... She pauses, lifting the torch, but Stacy keeps going. Amy peers at the vine hanging from the wall. There's a fifth
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: echoing eerily, and the flowers move in exact unison with the sound, their stamens vibrating, like so many miniature tuning forks: the plant is making the noise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Stacy... The shaft dead-ends at a blank wall, which is just materializing out of the darkness, fifteen feet in front of them. There's a sixth RING. Stacy points at the wall, quickening her pace.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's right here. I can-- Amy jumps forward, reaching for her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But there's another RING, and Stacy keeps going: she's nearly at the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop! Amy grabs her arm, hard, jerks her back a step, pulling her close, the torchlight flickering over them. She WHISPERS:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) There's no phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? A seventh RING sounds, seeming to come from beneath the vines on the floor of the shaft, directly in front of them. Stacy tries to pull free, to bend and reach toward the sound.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) I can-- Amy jerks her back again, WHISPERS straight into her ear:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's the vine. The flowers. They're making the noise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. It's-- She pulls free, steps forward, and her foot seems to punch straight through the shaft's floor. She SCREAMS, losing her balances Amy throws down the torch, lunges for her. The torch flutters, pales, but remains lit. The vines growing across the floor fall away, revealing an opening, another shaft, dropping into the earth. Stacy is slowly sliding into it, scrambling to stop herself. Amy grabs Stacy arm. Stacy is dangling, from the waist down, over the hole's edge. There are vines in the hole, too, and. they begin to coil around her legs, pulling at her, dragging her downward. Stacy SCREAMS again, kicking to free herself, scrambling upward, monkey-like, while Amy pulls at her, and finally they manage to drag her to safety. A beat, then Amy retrieves the torch, holds it out over the hole. The bottom is twenty feet down, almost lost in shadow. Dimly, WE SEE a woman, lying curled against the wall--she has long dark hair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Oh my God. The woman stirs, her body rolling, as if to turn and look at us, and WE SEE her face: she's a corpse. The vine has invaded her flesh--it's in her eye sockets, the hollow of her mouth, writhing and churning. Stacy and Amy SCREAM. There's a WHISTLING sound, like a whip, and a tendril lashes out from the shaft's wall, wraps itself around the torch's handle, yanks it from Amy's grip. The torch falls into the hole, still burning. When it hits bottom, a mass of vine surges across it, smothering its flame. It's very dark after this: Amy and Stacy are barely discernible. A beat of silence, then an odd, high-pitched
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: rises all around them; it sounds like laughter-- eerie, childlike, full of echoes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . As it steadily increases in volume, that WHISTLING comes once more: the vines SMACK at them from the floor, the ceiling, the walls, coiling around their bodies, pulling them toward the open shaft. They both SCREAM again, scrambling backward, while the vine keeps coming, more and more of it, grabbing at their arms, their legs, their necks. They stumble over each other, falling onto their hands and knees.amid the.tendrils. The vine catches at them, tries to hold them down. It's not strong enough, though; they yank it off, and thrash their way, foot by foot, back toward the sling, the vine lashing at them, grabbing, tearing, sap leaking onto their skin. The laughter grows still louder, the whole shaft ECHOING with it. Amy reaches the sling first, with Stacy right behind her. Even here, the vine continues to attack them, whipping and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and LAUGHING. Amy holds the sling toward Stacy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You. But Stacy is too hysterical: she just stands there, SOBBING, SCREAMING. Jeff's voice comes toward them from above,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (0.S.) Amoy...? Amy pulls the sling over her own head. YELLS:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pull us up!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Did you find it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She reaches out, grabs Stacy, wrapping her arms and legs around her. Stacy returns the embrace, both of them clutching at each other, as the windlass finally begins to
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: lifting the two of them into the air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - IN THE SLING The vines hanging from the shaft's walls whip at the girls as they rise, coiling around their bodies, pulling at them, that strange LAUGHTER growing ever louder, seeming to buffet their bodies. Stacy and Amy grip each other with all their strength, eyes shut tight. Stacy SCREAMS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THE HILL - DAY The SCREAM comes faintly toward us. The Mayans are arrayed about their campsite, all of them motionless, silent, staring up the hill with their impassive expressions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The weather has shifted; a wind has risen. The sun is setting, a red smudge behind a dark gray wall of clouds. Mathias lies.on his backboard, unconscious, his breathing coming in that ragged RASP, a thread of brown liquid leaking from the corner of his mouth. Amy is crouched beside him; she leans forward, wipes away the liquid. Stacy sits in the clearing behind her, leaning against Eric. They're both slick with sweat, but Stacy keeps shivering, as if cold. Eric's arms are around her, and her eyes are shut. Jeff is peeling the orange. Like Amy, he's still spattered and stained with Mathias's blood. The vine has continued to grow on everyone's clothes, weblike, eating away at the fabric. Jeff reaches, tugs free a strand of it, and a six- inch tear appears in his T-shirt. Stacy opens her eyes; she leans forward, peers down at the wounds on her leg, her right hand moving to her chest, probing at her rib cage. She turns to Eric:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Check your phone. Eric pushes himself to his feet, steps toward his pack. He pulls out his phone, flips it open. He shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Let me see. Eric carries the phone to her, then stands over her while she opens it, stares down at it. She shuts it, opens it again. Then again, and again, and suddenly she's CRYING, bent into herself. Eric drops to a crouch, rests his hand on her knee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shh. But her crying increases; she begins to SOB. Jeff is bent' over the orange, dividing it into four equal piles--its peel, too--concentrating. He lifts his head, stares. Amy stands up, hurries over., kneels in front of Stacy, takes her hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's okay, sweetie. You're okay. Stacy keeps WEEPING, uncontrollably, shaking her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wanner go home. I wanna leave...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shh... She's WAILING, rocking back and forth; she can't seem to stop. Amy struggles to calm her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stacy... Stacy keeps WAILING, rocking, eyes shut. Amy leans in close.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Let's play the game...can you do that? Huh? Can you give me a "So"? Stacy continues to CRY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Come on. Just try. Can you try? (a beat) So there was this girl who wanted to be a pilot. Stacy's tears keep coming. Amy looks at Eric, gives him a nod,'prodding him into speech. He hesitates, then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But she was scared of heights.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So she became a lifeguard instead. (she squeezes Stacy's
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ) Come on. Your turn. More SOBS. Amy glances across the clearing at Jeff, wanting him to join in, too. It seems as if he might refuse, but then her look hardens, and he relents.

direction.raw_text: So she wore a life vest. (she squeezes Stacy's hand
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ) Come on. Now you. A beat, then Stacy takes a deep, ragged breath. She wipes at her face, struggles for words.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But everyone... She trails off, CRYING again. Amy nods, encouraging her.
