direction.raw_text: Yeah...? Everyone what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They laughed at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good. That's good. So she-- Very suddenly, it starts to rain--a dozen large, heavy drops. They all glance skyward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He springs to his feet. And then: a downpour, a deluge, as if a trap door has swung open in the clouds. The rain falls in a loud, drumming rush, turning the clearing to mud. Eric jumps up, too. He and Jeff start digging through the backpacks from the. blue tent, searching for something-- anything--in which to catch the water. They find a small plastic bag, a nylon toiletry kit, a Frisbee. Jeff sets these in a row on the ground, open to the rain. Eric rushes to the orange tent, vanishes inside. Amy tilts back her head, tries to catch the rain in her open mouth. Stacy just sits there, hugging herself, shivering, still half- crying. They're all drenched, back-spattered with mud. And then, as abruptly as it had begun, the rain starts to slacken. Eric reemerges from the orange tent, carrying a thermos, a plastic cup. He sets them next to the other containers, but it's pointless; the rain is already stopping. They all stare at these meager receptacles: they've managed to catch less than half an inch of muddy-looking water. Jeff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ; he's FURIOUS with himself:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) We should've been ready. We
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He kicks the Frisbee across the clearing. Amy jumps up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She steps forward, as if to guard the other containers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It doesn't fucking matter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There was water in it. He spins toward her, turning his fury with himself on her:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How much, Amy? Two and a half gallons? 'Cause that's what we need. For today--just to make it through today. And then tomorrow the same all over again. And for how long? Another week before our parents start searching? And then what? How long till they track us to Coba? Or to this fucking hill? How long will it take, Amy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You said--

direction.raw_text: It's not gonna happen. We're not gonna make it. The others stare at him in astonishment, too 'stunned to speak. He gives them all a look of disgust:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) And you're fucking playing games. (mimicking Amy's voice) So there were these people trapped in the jungle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't, Jeff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But they didn't have any water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Amy looks as if she might start crying.

direction.raw_text: Please, don't.

direction.raw_text: So they're gonna die of thirst. Amy covers her ears with her hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut up!

direction.raw_text: But this fucking vine might kill them first.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: STOP IT! Jeff paces away, struggling to regain control of himself. A long beat, and then, very QUIETLY:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry ...I'm sorry. He steps back toward the dismembered orange, crouches over it. The fruit and peels are muddy now, spoiled looking. He waves for the others to approach.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Come on. We need to eat. No one moves. They're all staring at him with their shocked expressions. He can't seem to meet their eyes. He gestures at the orange again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) The peel, too. Everything. Abeat, then the others step forward to claim their portions: first Eric, then Stacy, then Amy. They eat without speaking. Finally, almost AS IF TALKING TO HIMSELF:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) It'll rain again. It has to. And we'll figure out a way to catch it. (he nods to himself) We'll be fine. We'll ration the -food. And then, you know, we'll just...we'll tough it out.. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) People have survived for weeks with nothing. Just water, a little bit of water. So why not us? No one responds. They continue to eat: the fruit, the peels. Their torn clothes cling wetly to them. Jeff uncaps the water bottle, offers it to Amy. She drinks, passes it on. It moves around the circle, back to Jeff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about the vine? Jeff takes his sip, caps the bottle. He's reclaiming himself, his voice strengthening, his confidence returning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think it can hurt us. Not directly. if it could, it already would've, wouldn't it? Why would it wait? The others are silent, considering this. Then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) It's not strong enough to overpower us. And it-- Mathias GASPS suddenly, his entire body spasming for a moment, before the watery RASP of his breathing resumes. He doesn't regain consciousness; his eyes remain shut. Everyone watches him for a beat: he, also, is spattered with mud.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's gonna die, isn't he? if there's no phone, then there's no--

direction.raw_text: Me, too. They all turn to look at her. She's massaging that spot on her rib cage again, digging into it with her fingers.

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) It's eating me. Just like him. And her. She waves toward the shaft. Jeff gives her a weary look.

direction.raw_text: Don't, Stacy. Don't start. She jumps up, begins to pace, agitated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's inside me. In my leg. My chest. I can feel it. Right here.. She stops pacing, lifts her shirt. She points to the base of her rib cage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) See? Jeff stares; there's nothing there. He shakes his head. The knife is lying in the mud beside him, and Stacy steps forward, snatches it up. Jeff reaches to stop her, but he's too slow. She stands before him, hefting it. in her hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Put it down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll show you. She lifts her.shirt again, pressing at her rib cage with her .fingertips. Jeff stands up, holds out his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give it to me. Right now. Amy and Eric stand, too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But she's already cutting: a four inch slit along the base of her rib cage. Amy SCREAMS. A horizontal line of blood crests the wound, sweeps down across Stacy's stomach, soaking into the waistband of her shorts. She watches it, frowning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought it would just come tumbling out. She probes at the cut with the point of the knife, prying it farther open, the bleeding increasing. Jeff reaches, grabs the knife from her. He looks furious:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Sit down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's hiding. It's right-- She pokes her finger into the wound, digging. Jeff slaps her hand away. He YELLS:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a il hi12 f down i He shoves her down, onto her back, then picks up the towel he'd used to hold the heated stone. He balls it up, presses it to Stacy's wound. Eric retrieves the bottle of tequila from the mud, uncaps it. He crouches beside Stacy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't yell. she's just scared.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: what're you doing? He's lifting the bottle toward Stacy's mouth, but he hesitates now, turning toward Jeff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just a sip. To calm her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It'll dehydrate-her.

direction.raw_text: A sip, Jeff. He starts to lift the bottle again. Jeff shoves it aside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I said Q.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leave him alone. She tries to sit up, but Jeff pushes her back down, hard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You realize how stupid you're being? Sticking that dirty knife
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's growing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of ina's.inside you. You're imagining it, and you just--

direction.raw_text: I'm gonna end up like her. That girl. I'm gonna--

direction.raw_text: Get infected. Understand? You're gonna get yourself killed.

direction.raw_text: You're not listening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shouting, very loud)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! A beat of startled silence, and then her voice comes again, from across the hilltop, sounding exactly like her, only slightly fuzzed, a rasping quality just beneath the words:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! They all turn to look, but there's nothing there, just the vine, its green leaves, its bright red flowers. Stacy's voice comes once more, from the.opposite direction now:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the-- Stacy's voice keeps coming, switching locations, seeming to float across the hilltop; they turn, tracking it.

direction.raw_text: ...! YOU'RE NOT LISTENING...! YOU'RE NOT LISTENING...! Amy steps toward Jeff, looking frightened.

direction.raw_text: The Mayans.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut up...! Stacy's voice continues, but now that high-pitched LAUGHTER is coming, too, a chorus of it, growing in volume:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...! YOU'RE NOT LISTENING...! YOU'RE NOT LISTENING...! Stacy's weeping has deepened to SOBS. She keeps YELLING:

direction.raw_text: Shut up...! Shut up...! The LAUGHTER grows steadily LOUDER, obscuring Stacy's voice:

direction.raw_text: the flowers trembling, visibly vibrating as they sculpt the sound...

direction.raw_text: The light is fading fast. One of the Mayan women is cleaning a pot with a handful of leaves. Three of the men sit facing the hillside, their bows in their laps. The others are bedding down beneath the trees. The LAUGHTER echoes down the hill, eerie and ghoulish, yet the Mayans betray no reaction to it, as if it were no more worthy of note to them than the steady RASPING of the locusts in the jungle at their backs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jeff, Stacy and Amy lie side-by-side in the darkness. The liquid RATTLE of Mathias's breathing comes from the clearing, sounding as if someone were sawing at a tin can. Jeff and Stacy are asleep; Amy is stirring restlessly, shifting first onto one side, then the other. Finally, she rises, moves toward the flap, slips quietly through it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The moon is out, dropping its faint light upon us. Mathias is on his backboard beneath the little lean-to, more audible than visible, with his PHLEGM-CLOTTED breathing. Eric is beside him. He looks up as Amy emerges from the tent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now is he? Eric shrugs, waves toward the backboard: it seems clear enough. Amy stares-for a moment, then sits beside him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) You can go lie down if you want. Eric lifts his hand, pushes a button on his watch, makes it glow. He squints at it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I still have forty minutes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't mind. I can't sleep. Eric checks his watch again, its glow briefly illuminating his face. He gestures toward the tent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is Stacy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They both are. There's a slight breeze, and the tent makes a FLAPPING SOUND in it. They both turn to stare at it. Then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Do you think it's inside her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (he shakes his head) Jeff cut it out. I saw him.

direction.raw_text: But she says she can feel it. Moving. Shifting about. Eric waves this aside.

direction.raw_text: You know how Stacy is. She's just scared. She gets things in her head, and--- Mathias makes a RETCHING sound--loud, wet, painful--and they both turn,apeering at his gaunt form through the darkness. He falls QUIET; his eyes don't open. A beat, then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) I've been sitting here, you know, making all these deals in my head with God. You ever do that? Amy just stares at him. He has his arms wrapped around his knees, hugging them to his chest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Like I say, okay, you can fire me on the first day teaching if that's what you want--just let us make it home. But that doesn't mean shit, 'cause I don't even really want the job, and He has to know that, doesn't He? So I say, all right, Stacy can leave me, you know, or even, I don't know, I'll give up a finger, okay? Or two fingers. Or fuck it, take a hand, take my left hand, but let us just get home, all of us. (a beat) And then I look at him-- (he nods toward Mathias) --and I can't help it, I'm, like, take him if you need to, take Mathias, and let the rest of us go. That's fucking horrible, isn't it? And once I've said it, I feel like I can't take it back, you know? (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Like the words have gone up into the sky and God's sort of thinking about them now, making his choice, and if Mathias dies and we don't, it'll be.like I killed him, won't it? Like I-- Amy starts to CRY; she covers her mouth with her hand. Eric stares at her in surprise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) What? What is it? Amy shakes her head. She struggles to stop, but she can't.

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry ...I'm so sorry... (a beat) It's my fault.

direction.raw_text: what is?

direction.raw_text: If I hadn't stepped onto the hill-- Her crying INCREASES. Eric leans, touches her hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's stupid, Amy. That's--

direction.raw_text: Jeff said it. He said-- Eric reaches, puts his arm around her, trying to quiet her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He didn't mean it. There's no way. He was just--

direction.raw_text: We might not have...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shh. Don't. She rests her head on his shoulder, WEEPING, her body shaking with it, while he pats her, stroking her hair.

direction.raw_text: Stacy and Jeff, eyes shut, sleeping. Very SOFTLY, there comes a faint PANTING, rhythmic, furtive sounding. Stacy's eyes open; she lies there, listening. There's a MOAN, and the PANTING QUICKENS. Stacy rises to a sitting position. She listens for another beat, then leans, prods at Jeff. He awakes with a jerk, blinking up at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wh--? Stacy holds her finger to her lips, silencing him.. From outside, there's another MOAN. Jeff sits up, listening. The
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: TING is BUILDING toward a climax. Jeff leans toward the pile of supplies at the tent's rear, squinting at the tangle of vine growing across it. He points, WHISPERING:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) It's the-- But Stacy is already pushing herself to her feet. She moves quickly to the tent's flap, UNZIPS it, crouches out into:

direction.raw_text: Mathias's breathing continues its RAGGED course. Amy is still leaning into Eric, her head on his shoulder. He has his arm around her. He looks up, blinking, as Stacy emerges from the tent into the moonlight. . STACY What the fuck, Eric? Amy lifts her head, wipes at her face; Eric drops his arm from her shoulder. They both stare at Stacy, startled by her anger. Jeff appears behind her, stepping through the flap.

direction.raw_text: What?

direction.raw_text: The hillside falls away from us, the narrow trail winding down its face to the clearing and the wall of jungle beyond. The sun is just rising, and the vine seems to shimmer in it. Three of the Mayan encampments are visible from here: one directly beneath us, one to the left, another to the right. Thin ribbons of smoke rise from their campfires.

location: CLEARING/BASE OF THE HILL -- FROM UP THE HILL

direction.raw_text: Jeff stands there, staring down toward the jungle. Eric and Stacy are sitting together in the clearing behind him, holding hands; Stacy is still CRYING softly. Amy approaches across the hilltop, stops beside Jeff.

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) To keep the ground clear. It grows so quickly... He gestures at their clothes, upon which that green webbing of vine continues to spread, eating away at the fabric.

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) It's old, too--has to be. Really old. Because the birds, the insects... somehow they've evolved. They've learned not to land here. (he peers about them, at the vine-covered hill) And the horses. Remember? How frightened they were? They knew, too. They stand in silence for a beat, staring down the hill toward the Mayans. direction.raw_text: You'll have to lift him. Eric hesitates; he seems reluctant to touch the corpse. Finally, he girds himself, straddles the backboard, grabs Mathias under his armpits, lifting him. Jeff leans forward, starts to pull the sleeping bag over Mathias's head. The corpse seems intent upon resisting them; its arms keep getting tangled, catching and snagging. Jeff and Eric have to wrestle with it, both of them PANTING, sweating, before they manage to shove it into the bag. Jeff ZIPS the bag shut, and they stand over it, catching their breath, wiping the perspiration from their faces.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Should we say something?

direction.raw_text: . Jeff gives him a blank stare.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She lifts her shirt, twisting to show him. it looks as if a large starfish has been implanted just beneath her skin. It's moving, too, inching slowly but visibly downward. They all stare in astonishment. Amy GASPS, points at Stacy's leg. Stacy bends to see: there's more vine here, a snakelike lump winding its way upward from the top of her shin to her inner thigh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - FIRE Another small pile of clothes, burning with that blue, alcohol-fueled flame.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Can I give her some? The knife is placed in the fire, and WE PULL BACK TO REVEAL:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amy holds up the bottle of tequila. Jeff is crouching over the fire, heating the knife's blade. Be glances toward her, nods. Stacy is sitting down, staring at the bulge in her leg with a dazed expression. Eric is beside her. Amy offers the bottle to Stacy;-they all watch as she takes a long swallow. Then she hands the bottle back to Amy, and Jeff pulls the knife from the fire, carries it toward her. He gestures to Eric and Amy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hold her hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . They each take one of her hands. Jeff crouches over her leg.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) You might want to shut your eyes. Stacy shakes her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to see. Jeff hesitates; for a moment it seems-as if he might argue. But then, very quickly, he leans forward and draws the knife in one smooth movement up and around Stacy's leg. Stacy
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: her body tensing, but she doesn't cry out. The incision reveals the vine, a foot long, its leaves and flowers clotted with Stacy's blood, which is oozing from the wound. Jeff reaches in, pries the tendril from her flesh. Stacy MOANS again, arching backward, as the vine emerges: writhing and twisting. The blood comes more thickly now, pumping from the wound, running down her leg. Jeff drops the tendril into the dirt, steps on it, grinding it into stillness. Stacy is breathing HARD, almost hyperventilating. She's shut her eyes.

direction.raw_text: Should I stop? Stacy shakes her head, vehemently. Jeff glances at the others. Eric shakes his head, too. Amy's eyes, like Stacy's, are tightly shut.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) You'll have to roll over. Stacy lets go of the others' hands, rolls onto her stomach. She hitches up her shirt, revealing the small of her back, the starfish-shaped bulge. Jeff crouches at her side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Ready? She nods, and he leans, makes five quick incisions, in the shape of an asterisk, directly above the bulge. Stacy's body goes rigid, and Eric takes her hand again. Once more, we can see the tendril through the incision: dark with her blood. Jeff reaches in and slowly pulls the vine from her body. There's an astonishing amount of it; he has to drop the knife and use both hands to drag the slimy mass free.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . As the plant emerges from her body--thrashing, coiling and uncoiling, covered in half-clotted blood, like a newborn-- Stacy starts to SCREAM.

direction.raw_text: The Mayans at their campsite: three of them on guard duty, the others napping in the shade beneath the trees. Stacy's

direction.raw_text: They've pulled a shirt from one of the backpacks, torn it into strips, and used these to bandage Stacy's wounds, tying them around her leg and torso. She's lying on her side, eyes shut, her head in Eric's lap. He's stroking her hair. Jeff is counting the grapes into four separate piles. Amy sits watching him. When he finishes, he gestures for her to take a pile. Then he scoops Stacy and Eric's rations up, carries them over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you eat? Stacy sits up, wincing; her bandages are soaked through with blood. She takes the grapes from him; Eric does, too. They- all begin to eat, in silence. When they're done, Jeff passes the water bottle around their circle. Then:

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) We should try to rest, I guess. (he waves toward the tent) Get out of the sun. We're losing moisture out--

direction.raw_text: There's nothing there, Stacy.

direction.raw_text: My calf, too. she lifts her right leg, turning it to show the others. Jeff bends to look. Again, there's no visible sign of the vine. He shakes his head.

direction.raw_text: No more cutting. Not unless--- The knife is in the dirt beside him, and Stacy leans forward, tries to grab it. Jeff is too quick for her, though: he snatches it up, tucks it into his belt. Stacy is becoming more and more upset. She holds out her hands, BEGGING:

direction.raw_text: Please, Jeff.

direction.raw_text: Shh. Stacy SOBS into Amy's shoulder, her body jumping. Amy strokes her. Eric steps across the clearing, picks up the bottle of tequila. He glances at Jeff, and Jeff nods.

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) You're scared, honey. You're just scared. You know? Stacy nods; she's still CRYING, but it's growing quieter. Eric crouches beside her, holds out the bottle of tequila. Stacy just stares at it. Amy encourages her:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) It'll help. Stacy accepts the bottle, takes a long swallow. Then another. The others watch her in silence. Finally:

Amy pulls her to her feet, helps her hobble across the clearing to the tent. Jeff and Eric sit-there, watching in silence as they vanish through the flap.

direction.raw_text: Sunlight filters through the orange nylon; all four of them lie sleeping in a row, sweating. The vine has shredded their clothes to tatters; they look like castaways. The tent's flap hangs open, billowing gently in a slight breeze.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Stacy open her eyes. She lies there, staring up toward the orange nylon above her. The blood on her bandages has dried to a dark red, bordering on black. She sits up, stares about the tent. Eric is on one side of her, then Amy, then Jeff. Jeff is on his back, the knife still tucked into his belt. Stacy rises quietly, steps over Amy, crouches above him, staring down at the knife. She reaches, tries to slip it free, but then jerks back when Jeff shifts in his sleep. She hesitates, watching him. She seems as if she's about to try again, but then the tent flap billows in the breeze, drawing her gaze. A beat, and she rises, steps carefully over Jeff, ducks outside into the clearing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stacy stands just beyond the tent's.flap. All is still, quiet.- She moves to Eric's pack, crouches over it, pulls out his phone. She flips it open, stares down at its screen: there's still no signal. She drops it back into the pack. She turns-to examine the clearing, her eyes falling upon the two backpacks from the blue tent. Their pockets are zippered open: Jeff and Eric's hurried pillaging during the downpour has scattered their contents across the dirt. Stacy rises, steps toward this tangled mound. She starts to dig through it, casually at first, but then with growing intensity, throwing T-shirts and jeans and shorts aside, probing deeply into the pile. Suddenly she goes still. Staring. Amid the sodden mass of clothing sits a knife in a small scabbard. As Stacy crouches there, the vines start to RUSTLE, a rippling motion passing across them, as. if a wind were sweeping the hillside. Stacy watches with a look of horror: it looks like the pelt of some giant animal, shaking itself. When it finally stops, she bends, reaching for the knife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jeff, Eric, and Amy, still sleeping. The tent's flap continues to billow in the breeze. Very faintly, from the clearing, WE HEAR a moan. Then the sound of WHIMPERING. Eric opens his eyes, listening. An instant later, very abruptly, there comes a sharp, rending SCREAM of pure pain. Eric jumps up, starts for the flap; Jeff is right behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eric emerges from the tent, then Jeff, then Amy. They stand there, staring, too horrified to move.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh my God. Stacy is on the far side of the clearing. She's pulled off her shirt, her shorts, and has cut much of the skin from her body. She doesn't notice them. She's bent over, slicing into her left thigh, peeling the skin back from the muscle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She turns, blood-streaked, wild-eyed, the knife in her hand; her skin is hanging from her in shreds. We can see her leg muscles, her abdominals, a glint of bone at her left elbow. Jeff starts forward, holding out his hand, very STERN:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give it. Now. Eric follows him. Amy stays by the tent; she's begun to CRY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please, honey. Just-- Stacy shakes her head; she's CRYING, too, her whole body shaking. Her hair is matted with blood; she looks terrified.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) I have to-- Eric steps toward her, from behind, reaching around her body for the knife, and she spins, reflexively, trying to fend him off. But the knife is in her hand, and it punches into his chest, just to the right of his sternum, sticking there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Eric looks at the knife in surprise. It's twitching back and forth with the beating of his heart. He starts to reach for it, but then his legs give out. He collapses, dropping to the dirt, which has grown muddy with Stacy's blood. Amy SCREAMS. Stacy's CRYING deepens; she takes a step toward Eric, but then her own body fails her. She falls to her knees in the bloody puddle, reaching toward him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Oh, no...no...no... I'm-- Eric is on his back; he struggles up onto one elbow. He tries to speak, but only a GAGGING sound emerges, blood frothing at his mouth. It's pumping thickly from his wound, too, saturating his shirt.

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) I didn't... Eric drops back again. He struggles RAGGEDLY for breath. Jeff lowers himself to his knees beside him, hesitating impotently over him, uncertain what to do. Stacy is SOBBING, shaking her head. There's blood everywhere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Kill me... Jeff turns, stares at her. Amy steps forward, crouches beside her. She takes Stacy's hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please. Just--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shh.

direction.raw_text: It hurts. It hurts so much. Eric tries to rise again. The blood surges from his wound when he moves. Jeff presses him back down.

direction.raw_text: Easy. Try to-- Stacy clutches at Amy, begging, her voice HOARSE with pain:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kill me. I can't She stops in mid-sentence, staring. Jeff and Amy follow her gaze. A half dozen tendrils are snaking into the clearing, reaching toward Eric's body. Jeff jumps to his feet. The tendrils begin to wrap themselves around Eric's limbs, and Jeff bends to tear them away. More and more keep coming, though. Eric has started to convulse, GAGGING, his head cocked back. Jeff keeps yanking the tendrils away, but there are far too many of them; they coil around Eric's legs, pulling at him. The blood has stopped pumping from his wound; his body has gone still.

direction.raw_text: The sleeping bag in which they'd enshrouded Mathias is moving: he's thrashing about within it, struggling to sit up. And he's SHOUTING, too, his voice MUFFLED by the bag:

direction.raw_text: ...! HENRICH...! He seems to be tearing at the bag with his arms.

direction.raw_text: Jeff hesitates just for an instant, staring in astonishment, then he's sprinting across the clearing. He bends, struggles for the zipper.

direction.raw_text: It's okay. I'm right here. I'm-- He UNZIPS the bag, and an immense tangle of vine cascades out onto the dirt. Its flowers are a pale pink; they're opening and closing, still calling, louder now:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...! HENRICH...! The thick clot of tendrils writhes spasmodically, coiling and uncoiling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Entwined within it are Mathias's bones, already stripped clean of flesh. The vine falls SILENT. A beat, then it starts to laugh, a low mocking CHUCKLE. On the opposite side of the little clearing, Stacy begins to
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: shaking her head, SOBBING.

direction.raw_text: ...! KILL ME...! Jeff stands there, perfectly still. Amy is holding Stacy, struggling unsuccessfully to quiet her:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shh. Shh. The vine's laughter grows steadily. LOUDER, punctuated by Stacy's SHOUTS:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...! KILL ME...: Amy turns, stares at Jeff. Blood is running off Stacy's body in strings. The vine has dragged Eric to the edge of the clearing; only his head and torso are still visible. Jeff strides toward him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...! KILL ME...! Jeff bends, yanks the knife from Eric's chest. Then he starts across the clearing toward Stacy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Mayans in their campsite. They're all staring up the hill, listening. Stacy's voice ECHOES toward us:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...! KILL ME...I KILL-- And then, abruptly, it goes SILENT.

direction.raw_text: Amy sits beside Stacy, who lies on her back in the puddle of blood, arms thrown out, the knife stuck hilt-deep in her chest. Eric's body is barely visible at the edge of the clearing; the vine RUSTLES softly as it consumes him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Jeff is pulling their remaining supplies from his knapsack: the bananas, the raisins, the pretzels, the protein bars, the nuts, the water, iced tea, and Coke. He has a bloody strip of fabric tied around the wound on his hand. Amy watches as he arranges the food in front of her. She's
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: silently, tears running down her dirt-smeared cheeks. Jeff peels one of the bananas: it's dark brown, far too ripe. He holds it out to her. She just stares at it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on. You'll need the energy. He reaches for her hand, puts the banana in it. She holds the fruit, but makes no move to eat. Finally, VERY QUIETLY:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I still think we should wait. Jeff SIGHS: it's clear they've already been through this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll only get weaker.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They'll come looking. You said
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nobody's coming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Our parents--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All they'll find are our bones. Amy is silent, staring down at the banana.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) We don't have time for this, Amy. You'll need as much daylight as possible. He waves upward, toward the sun, which has passed its peak, begun its slow slide westward. Amy squints toward it for a beat, and then, almost despite herself, lifts the banana to her mouth. She bites, chews, swallows, still mutely crying. Jeff peels the second banana; he hands it to her as soon as she finishes the first. Be watches her eat,.silent. He's tearing open the bag of pretzels when another tendril snakes into the clearing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . They both watch it, neither of them moving. It's joined by a second tendril, then a third, a fourth;.the vines coil around Stacy's body, begin to drag it from the clearing. Amy's
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: grows more forceful, her body shaking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Shh. Jeff reaches, strokes her. The vine pulls Stacy's body into itself, burying it. Amy watches, struggling to control. herself. Her voice emerges as little more than a WHISPER:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want to. I don't... She shakes her head, wipes at her face: the tears, the snot, the sweat, the dirt. Her clothes are falling off her body, eaten to shreds. Jeff's, too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Why can't we both? Jeff hesitates a.beat. Then, clearly not believing it:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We might. He hands her the pretzels; she takes them, watching his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It'll take them a moment to react. If I can make it to the trees... He trails off, shrugs. Amy keeps staring at him; she doesn't believe this either. He SIGHS again, holds up his hand, pulls the bandage from his wound: it's three inches long, a deep gash into his palm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) How long till it's inside me? Amy is silent. He flexes his hand, and the wound opens, mouthlike, blood oozing thickly from it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) It already is, probably. I'll be just like Stacy soon. He turns, glances toward the spot where her body has disappeared. Amy looks, too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Then what? You, all alone on this hill... you know how that would end, don't you? Once more, Amy is silent. He waves for her to keep eating, and she starts in on the pretzels, mechanically. He opens the can of Coke, hands it to her; she takes a long sip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Once you're in the jungle, you drop and hide. Another tendril slithers forward. It slips into the immense puddle of blood beside Jeff and Amy, begins to drink it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) They'll never find you--it's too thick in there. Just burrow down, and they'll run right past. Jeff opens the can of nuts, sets it in front of Amy. Then he gets up, crouches over the puddle of blood. He cups. his hands, dips them into the puddle. He steps toward Amy, smears the blood across her T-shirt. Amy keeps eating.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) It's sudden movements that'll get you caught. So take your time. You step, then listen. Then another step, and listen again. He moves back to the puddle, which the lone tendril continues' to drain. He cups his hands, scoops up more blood, smears it on her tattered khakis. Amy has finished the pretzels; she reaches for the nuts, looking numb..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) East, always east--keep the sun at your back. He scoops up more blood from the puddle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd)' Arms. Amy holds out her arms, and he smears the blood on them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) You'll hear me yell. I'll yell your name.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He returns yet again to the puddle, then stands over her, the blood cupped in his hands, dripping.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) And you can't hesitate. Understand? Not for an instant. Amy nods, and he uncups his hands over her head. She shuts her eyes as the blood runs into her hair, down her forehead, her neck, her face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Three of the Mayan men, as usual, sit in the clearing, bows in their laps, facing the hill. The others are sheltering from the sun in the line of shade along the jungle's margin, some sleeping, some talking quietly together. One of the men in the clearing suddenly rises to his feet, nocking an arrow. The other two also rise. The Mayans along the clearing fall silent, staring up the hill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jeff is approaching down the trail, carrying Amy, pieta-like, in his arms. Her body is limp, apparently lifeless, and dripping with blood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The bald Mayan emerges from the tree line, followed by yet another man with a bow. They join the other three Mayans in the center of the clearing. They all watch as Jeff reaches the base of the trail, where he carefully lays Amy down. Jeff crouches over Amy, laying her arms across her chest, pushing the hair from her face. He bends, kisses her blood- smeared forehead. Then he glances up at the Mayans.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't even know her name. The Mayans just stare at him. He rises to his feet, pulling the knife from his belt: it's darkly stained with. blood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) You should. You should know who you're killing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He steps out into the clearing. The bald Mayan pulls his pistol from its holster, raises it, aiming at Jeff's chest. The others draw their bows. Jeff smiles, taps his sternum.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Jeff. Understand? My name's Jeff. He edges along the clearing's margin, keeping close to the vines, moving away from Amy's body. The Mayans follow him, weapons raised. After a handful of steps, he stops again, turns toward them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Can you say it? Huh? Again, the Mayans just stare. He SLAPS at his chest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Jeff. A beat, then he suddenly YELLS, waving the knife at the men.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Silence. The Mayans stand there with their weapons raised, waiting to see what he might do. A beat, then he starts walking once more, along the clearing's edge, away from Amy. Another ten yards and he stops again, waves up the hill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) There's Stacy, too. And Eric. Mathias. And Henrich. You've killed them all. He steps toward them. The bald man raises his hand, holds it up, palm out, next to his pistol. Jeff smiles at him again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) But not everyone. He LAUGHS, a little wildly, and shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Look at you, you stupid fucks. You have no idea what I'm saying, do you? He takes another step into the clearing. The bald man COCKS his pistol, loudly. Several of the other Mayans have emerged from the jungle; they stand there watching.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) One of us is gonna survive. You should know that name, too. You fuckers. You bastards. He takes yet another step forward. The bald man speaks a string of words IN MAYAN, with an edge of warning. More Mayans emerge from-the jungle, shielding their eyes against the sun, staring. No one is looking in Amy's direction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) It's not Jeff. He shakes his head, his voice dropping, almost to a WHISPER:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .(cont'd) It's not me. He takes another step. And then, still QUIETLY:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) It's Amy. You hear? He takes a deep breath, gathering himself. Then he YELLS-- JEFF (cont'd)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ; --and starts to run, straight at the Mayans. He only manages three steps before the bald man FIRES his pistol, and the others let their arrows fly. The bullet hits Jeff in the chest, just beneath his throat. One of the arrows misses; the other three strike his stomach, his left arm, his right thigh. Before he even hits the ground, there's a SHOUT from the Mayans along the treeline. The bald man turns. Amy is on her feet, sprinting for the jungle. The bald man raises. his pistol, FIRES, but the shot is too hurried; it goes wide. The others are still scrambling for fresh arrows as she vanishes into the trees. The bowmen sprint after her, disappearing into the jungle, leaving the bald man alone in the clearing with Jeff. The Mayan women stand motionless along the treeline, staring. after Amy: they look mortified, grief-stricken. Jeff is bleeding heavily from his wounds, struggling to crawl forward, his breath frothing pinkly at his lips. A half dozen tendrils slither into the clearing. They coil around his legs, start to drag him back toward the hill. Jeff fights them, kicking, MOANING, bleeding.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The bald man watches. He, too, looks grief-stricken. He steps forward, aims at Jeff's head. As he FIRES, WE:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: footsteps, moving quickly down a tiled floor.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: CUT TO A BLACK SCREEN WE HEAR

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) (a slight Spanish accent) She flagged down a tour bus, just west of Coba-- The voice CARRIES OVER into:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mexican DOCTOR, in his late fifties, balding, a little stooped, his white jacket buttoned over a shirt and tie, is hurrying down the corridor, accompanied by TERESA, a dark- haired woman in beige slacks, a blue blouse. Teresa has- a leather briefcase, a Blackberry on her belt. She's holding Amy's passport,. which she examines as they walk. It's smeared with dried blood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: --and collapsed before the driver even managed to open the door. The corridor is brightly lit, very clean. Rooms open off it on either side, and we glimpse the still.forms of sleeping patients as we pass, IVs hanging from metal stands beside their beds. It's very quiet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) She revived briefly, just after they brought her in. She was in bad shape--severely dehydrated, traumatized, in shock. And terribly frightened. It was impossible to make any sense of what she was saying. She was sobbing, hysterical. We had to sedate her. The doctor has a manila folder under his arm; he opens it, pulls out a piece of paper: a color printout of a digital photo. He hands it to Teresa.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Her clothes were torn; she was covered in blood. But not her own.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Teresa stares down at the photo: it shows Amy on a gurney, unconscious, blood-smeared, corpse-like.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now do you know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She has no wounds. A uniformed policeman sits on a chair outside one of the rooms at the end of the corridor, reading a newspaper. He rises as they approach. Teresa hands the printout back to the doctor; she keeps the passport.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's it? That's all you have?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm afraid so. Be nods to the policeman, and leads Teresa into:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A bed, a night stand, a curtained window. Amy lies with a sheet pulled to her chin, unconscious, an IV dripping into her arm. They've cleaned the blood off her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sits in a chair beside the bed. She's in her early twenties, with long dark hair tied in a bun. She stands up, stepping back from the bed, as the doctor and Teresa enter. The doctor addresses her in SUBTITLED SPANISH:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Has she stirred? The nurse shakes her head. The doctor moves to the bed. He takes Amy's wrist, feeling for her-pulse. Amy's eyes open at his touch. She stares at him, her arm hanging limply in his grasp. He smiles down at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) There you are... Teresa steps forward, and Amy's gaze shifts to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) My name is Dr. Hernandez... Amy's eyes return to the doctor;. they fall on his face, then drift down to his chest. The doctor gestures toward Teresa:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) And this is Ms. Bern, from the U.S. Consulate. Amy is staring at his white coat, her expression going slack, almost catatonic, all the life draining from it.
direction.name: direction
